Consumer complaint narrative: Back in XXXX, I attempted to make my first payment to Sallie Mae, it was almost {$600.00} on top of my other student loan payment of over {$600.00} to XXXX. I tried to figure out a way to pay both sets of student loan bills on top of my other bills ( car, gas, insurance, etc. ) I was able to consolidate my XXXX payments but Sallie Mae told me they could not help me. They told me my only options were forbearance, delinquency, or bankruptcy. I asked if there was any way they could lower my payments and again, my only options were forbearance, delinquency, or bankruptcy. I chose forbearance until I could figure out a solution. My forbearance ran from XXXX through XXXX, which I was required to pay $ XXXX loan as a good faith payment for a total of {$150.00}. I was instructed to call back at the end of XXXX to extend my forbearance. I was limited to one year and I could extend in 1, 2 or 3 month increments. I called back on Thursday, XXXX XXXX and the representative asked me why I was filing for forbearance. I simply replied that I could not afford the payment. She asked me a series of questions and I told her that my income, as a XXXX XXXX XXXX could not support me enough to be able to pay the {$600.00} / month. She gave me attitude and asked me if I looked into a 3rd party income driven repayment plan. So I went and looked into it. On Friday, XXXX XXXX, I applied for it and noticed that it went to my XXXX  loans and not my Sallie Mae. I contacted the federal student aid services, ( that 's who I filed my income driven payment application through ) and they informed me that I needed to contact Sallie Mae and fill out a paper application to send to them or input into their system. So I contacted Sallie Mae and the girl informed me that I needed to contact the Federal Student aid people and see if they could just send over my application or call XXXX and see if they could forward it to Sallie Mae. So I called XXXX and the very nice representative informed me that Sallie Mae is strictly private loans now and my Income driven application would not even be applied to those loans. At this point, I was irate. I called Sallie Mae back and was given the run around. Never once did someone at Sallie Mae tell me that my income driven application would n't be valid for private loans. Over a span of 40 minutes, I talked to customer service representatives who told me my only options were were forbearance, delinquency, or bankruptcy. I asked to speak to a supervisor and again he told me he could n't help me and my only options were forbearance, delinquency, or bankruptcy. The supervisor said he does n't work with collections when it comes to payments and that they could transfer me to collections and see what they could do. They told me to call back the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX of next month to see what they could do for me. I asked to be transferred to collections. Now, at this point, I have explained my situation 6 different times to representatives at Sallie Mae over the course of 2 days. As soon as I told the collections agent, the first thing he said was, this sounds like a customer service issue. I said oh no, they told me it 's a collections issue. So the collections representative from Sallie Mae explained that because I did forbearance for 3 months, I would need to wait till XXXX XXXX to call back, with the stipulation that I do n't make my payment for the month of XXXX so I go into delinquency. I explained over and over and over again that I do n't miss payments and that I did not want this to hurt my credit score. They assured me it would n't hurt my credit score and that the collections reps at Sallie Mae should be able to help me lower my payment. I am trying to be proactive and get ahead of this but Sallie Mae is not making this easy for me. The only reason my father cosigned my loan was because they wanted to give me some outrageous interest rate if I did n't have my father cosign. Even when I applied for the loan, I felt discriminated against because my loan disbursement and interest rate was based off amount of income my parents generated which I do n't think is appropriate since I am the one paying my loan off, not them. I am trying to pay my loan, that is both reasonable and affordable. I am sick of getting the same, ridiculous excuses. They had no problem giving me a loan with interest rates all over the place but now they expect me to pay back loans that I can not afford with my salary. I ca n't even live on my own, I have to live with my parents because my income does not allow me to support myself and pay my student loans. I am a XXXX XXXX XXXX, I am not making anywhere near six figures.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Trouble with how payments are being handled
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/17 Called to ask Navient to increase my monthly direct deposit from the minimum, and to apply the additional funds to the loan with the highest interest. I also asked that any additional payments I make, in addition to the newly increased minimum payment, be applied to that same loan as well. They said this was n't possible because the loans were consolidated. I asked to speak to someone who could help me and was put on hold for 20 minutes. Finally spoke to someone who reiterated that it was n't possible, then reversed course and said the loan with higher interest was not part of the consolidated loans, and that they could do this for me ( online there is no option for me to apply payments to individual loans, it says they are all consolidated ). I reiterated what I wanted, and they had forgotten to add the stipulation that any additional payments be put toward the loan with the higher interest rate. After being put on hold and waiting 5 min or more again, this was finally resolved as well.

I asked that they make this an option online for others, or at least train their customer service reps to identify the steps to help borrowers pay down their highest interest loans first, and was told that " we have to follow FCC guidelines. '' Not sure why this means they ca n't make the process of paying down higher interest loans first easier for borrowers.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am a XXXX resident at the University of XXXX  XXXX XXXX. On XXXX XXXX, XXXX I traveled to XXXX to visit my family for XXXX break. I tried accessing my coinbase account and they locked my account and sent me this email : Dear XXXX XXXX, Our records indicate that you have attempted to log in to your Coinbase account from a country in which Coinbase is prohibited by law from doing business ( XXXX ( XXXX XXXX of ) ) per the sanctions imposed by the U.S. Treasury Departments Office of Foreign Assets Control or other governing bodies. As a result, your account has been restricted. 

If you are not a resident of a sanctioned country or otherwise have received this notification in error, please visit https : //support.coinbase.com for assistance.provide us with a copy of a current, government-issued ID and proof of your current address, such as a utility bill or rental agreement. 

If, however, Coinbase concludes that you reside in a prohibited region or are violating applicable sanctions in any way, your account will be closed and Coinbase will take any other actions required by law. 

Additional information regarding account logins from prohibited regions is available here. 

Respectfully, The Coinbase Team I am deeply concerned that I will lose everything in my coinbase account, despite my repeated emails to coinbase with evidence to the contrary that I am not a resident of XXXX, ect. 

Despite my emails, I am afraid I would not get any response from coinbase support as they have replied to me with an automated response. I am horrified that they may seize my funds, I have already lost a lot of money. 

I provided coinbase support with photos of my driver license and my utility bill to my house in Maryland. I have contacted coinbase support on the day I was locked out and have sent several inquiry emails requesting a follow-up or a status update but still no clue or any sign of them. 

I visited XXXX to see my family and I dont really have any intent on going back. I visited coinbase.com just out of curiosity because of the the recent movement in BTC prices and I was immediately greeted by the above message. 

Please advise what to do and how should I proceed and if there is any way I can get my account reopened. 

Thank You

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative: As I gathered information to give to the STATE 'S ATTORNEY GENERAL. I did a search for REVENUE RECOVERY CORPORATION license. I have found they are in direct violation of TENNESSEE FAIR DEBT COLLECTION PRACTICES ACT 62-20-101. REVENUE RECOVERY CORPORATION does not have a VALID license in the state of TENNESSEE. Their license expired in XX/XX/XXXX, 2016. They can not collect on a debt. TENNESSEE FAIR DEBT COLLECTION PRACTICES ACT 62-20-105 states no person shall commence, conduct or operate any collection service business in this state unless such person holds a valid collection service license issued by the board under this chapter, or prior stat law. TENNESSEE FAIR DEBT COLLECTION PRACTICES ACT 62-20-108 ( a ) ( 1 ) Every collection service shall have, for each location at which it conducts business a location manager who has submitted an application on a form prescribed by the board. TENNESSEE FAIR DEBT COLLECTION PRACTICES ACT 62-20-123 states a willful violation of this chapter, or any rule lawfully promulgated thereunder, is a Class C misdemeanor. REVENUE RECOVERY CORPORATION is in direct violation. This will be the last communication I send before sending my evidence to the STATE 'S ATTORNEY GENERAL OFFICE.

My husband and I are having trouble understanding why did our mortgage company decided to extend our terms of our loan without our authorization. We did not know this until we realized that our payoff amount was too much! Wells Fargo Home Mortgage used a routine but, little notice form to sneak through mortgage modifications on unsuspecting homeowners. Our original loan was XXXX dollars and now its XXXX dollars plus escrow is XXXX as well as almost another XXXX to pay off our loan. That 's double the amount of the original loan. They modified the loan years ago and they did it to benefit from adding more years to the payoff time to get extra interest income generated by longer home loans. They asked us to pay three payments for a permanent loan modification, but that did n't happen.They foreclosed on our home and had a sale date. We had to file a chapter XXXX to save the home because our lender would not give us any options because they, said we owed too much on the loan. They are the reason why we owe this much! the HAMP program is being used by this company and others to collect cash from the government and to eventually foreclose on peoples houses, and make it harder to recover. I need them to explain the hidden fees, and I believe that they have set us up to fail, and that we are worse off than before. I want them to try to find a workout plan for us, who have fallen onto hardships and had a XXXX in the family, as well as loss of income do to XXXX. They are not helping people, but making money from the hardships of homeowners. They make {$1500.00} per modified mortgages that eventually ends up in bankruptcy. We are in bankruptcy now, but the payoff is not correct. They are not using the HAMP money in the right way.. Wells Fargo Home Mortgage is ripping home owners off, and the people who regulate them are not doing a good job of protecting the homeowners. We bailed the big banks out, but who is bailing us out! They are getting rich off the backs of poor and middle class people. Why do we have to fill out stacks of paper exposing our privacy, but the banks hold back everything that they do n't want the public to know. If we just ask the government to help us to help ourselves, its a handout! That was our tax dollars that we work for. When will we get our American dream? Suing these companies is n't enough, because the lawyers are going to get all of the money. We need to stop giving them money to do their jobs. They should not be paid to do the right thing. Why is the government paying them to help struggling homeowners to keep their homes.If we stay on this path, the country will stop believing in the American dream.Banks used to be the very thing that we could count on, and now they are the only ones getting bail out! Thank you,

I also probably wo n't be able to mail in on time because of holiday schedule, unless I pay extra for expedited shipping, plus I already threw out my bill because I always pay online through a 1-time ACH. This seems like a very underhanded move to get people charged late fees and to put blemishes on their record. I 'm shocked that this could even be allowed. I have paid on time/early on every payment since the loan started. This is completely ridiculous that a financial company can act this way.

Issue: Problem getting a card or closing an account
Sub-issue: Trouble getting a working replacement card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I ordered 24 American Express gift cards on XX/XX/XXXX for  {$700.00} ( order # XXXX ). I never received them. I called American Express gift card services on XX/XX/XXXX to check the status of my order and was told by XXXX, the customer service rep, that the cards were showing delivered to my front door at approximately XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. I informed XXXX that we had not received the gift cards and asked what my options were. XXXX put me on hold to check the status of the cards. When he got back on the line, XXXX informed me that all of the 24 gift cards had been used and that he was going to open a fraud investigation to look into a resolution. He told me to " not worry '' and that I would have a resolution within 7-10 business days. I asked him if I should submit a credit card dispute to which XXXX said no and suggested we wait until we hear back from the investigation team. We waited. 
I then called American Express gift card services on XX/XX/XXXX to check status and was told that this was still being investigated and that I would " for sure '' hear from someone the following week. I did not receive any updates. I then called gift card services on XX/XX/XXXX to check status and was told that the investigation was still showing open and was being worked on. I was also told that there no updated notes and that there was no one in the investigation dept that we can request status from. I asked to then speak with a supervisor who told me the same thing and said that my only option was to wait. At that time I submitted a credit card dispute to American Express for the {$700.00} charge since I was not getting any resolution or option for replacement cards from the gift card dept. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a letter from XXXX credit card services stating that the {$700.00} charge was being credited to me while the dispute investigation took place. 
There were no updates from either dept until XX/XX/XXXX when I received a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX from the credit card dept stating that they were able to confirm with " the merchant '' ( which was their American Express gift card dept ) that the cards were delivered so that the charge of {$700.00} was valid and being placed back onto my account. I was appalled that the two departments were not talking and that the credit card team was not aware that the gift cards had been stolen and that it was under investigation. I then got on the phone on XX/XX/XXXX and called the gift card dept asking for all the merchant information of the 24 cards that were used so that I was able to call the merchants individually and submit fraud disputes with them. I want to be able to show American Express that these charges that were completed were not by me and that these cards were in fact stolen from my front porch. I was able to pin down the merchants, the charge amounts and the times of the transactions which is able to show that these were not charges that neither my husband or myself completed ... proving as my claim has said that these cards were stolen from my front porch. I have been able to open fraud investigations with two of the merchants where the thieves shopped the most & on the same day the gift cards were delivered ( XX/XX/XXXX ), XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX as well as XXXX XXXX in XXXX. They will both be disputing the charges with American Express directly and also will be able to identify who signed for the transaction. At this point, I am disappointed that there has been no resolution and it has been over a month since we ordered the gift cards. I have been more than patient, called to follow up several times and even completed by own investigation to show that these items were clearly stolen. I would hope that this does not happen to another consumer and that XXXX

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Trouble with how payments are being handled
Consumer complaint narrative:
Last year, in XXXX XXXX, I received a phone call that I had not paid my Discover student loans in 3 months and they were raising my interest rate. I received no calls prior, no emails announcing that my auto-payment had stopped. I paid the amount and my interest rate increased. 

Today, XXXX/XXXX/XXXX, I checked my credit score only to find that my student loans were again three months past due, amounting to over {$1000.00}. I was completely unaware that my auto-payments had stopped again ( for the second time ), no phone call, no letter. When I looked at my file, the last letter that was sent, was in XXXX and did not state anything about the auto-payments being stopped. 

As of today, I am {$1400.00} in debt ( 4 months past due ) and I had no idea that my payments were not coming out of my account. Almost all of my bills are on auto-payment, so I do not think twice. 

This has hurt my credit and caused me immense stress and frustration, because I have always wanted to pay my student loans on time. Why is this so hard? Additionally on the XXXX XXXX XXXX website, everytime I try to log in, it has me create a new password. Every single time, this glitch makes it incredibly difficult to casually log on to check account information, causing further frustration.

Issue: Managing, opening, or closing your mobile wallet account
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am locked out of my account with XXXX usd out of access and no matter what I can not get coinbase to respond with anything that actually resolves this. 
I lost, and have now replaced, a 2 factor authentication device ( my old phone ). I previously complained to the CFPB about this. Coinbase replied in a way that indicated that they had not even read any aspect of the complaint at all. They have taken zero real steps towards resolving the issue. 

The response they sent to me after the CFPB forwarded my initial complaint was an auto-message identical to the first one they sent to me. This indicates that no one had even read my emails to them. 

I really need a solution to this now as my assets are depreciating and they are denying me access to my funds and are misrepresenting the situation to both BBB and CFPB by saying that I will be contacted by an agent. I have received absolutely zero assistance from coinbase other than additional auto-messages ( many of which are repeats ) which do not resolve my issue. A human agent is needed to solve it. 

I have created a new account as instructed several months ago before they stopped replying the first time. Now the site claims my id is invalid. This was not the case when I used the same id to send them money. It must have become invalid now that I want to withdraw it seems. 

I feel at this point they are sending me in circles and have read none of my messages. No genuine attempt whatsoever has been made to restore my account access despite months of trying. Any time they reply, it 's an auto message, and then there is no further contact. Even after the CFPB asked for a reply, I was only sent an identical auto message which clearly indicated that no one had read my messages. This can been seen in my attached ( fourth attempt ) to get a real reply from them. 

Furthermore, many many other people seem to be in similar situations with this company as complaints are becoming highly visible online.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I took out a credit card from Capital One several years ago after experiencing a XXXX illness which left me XXXX XXXX. My current interest rate under this credit card is 25.90 %. While I understand that my credit rating is not stellar, I always pay much more than the minimum balance each month to Capital One. I also have a car loan through Capital One which also has a much higher annual percentage interest rate. I realized after the XXXX illness that I would need to rebuild my credit after my inability to pay for my monthly medications under XXXX. XXXX has a {$3700.00} out of pocket expense on Tier One medications. 
Once I reach the {$3700.00} out of pocket expense, I go into the Medication Coverage Gap which means I then have to pay ANOTHER {$4700.00} out of pocket for medications. As I am a XXXX XXXX XXXX, I require about a dozen different medications. When I am in the XXXX Coverage Gap,  XXXX raises their out of pocket expense on XXXX and other life saving medications. I pay the highest premium under the XXXX Part D program for medications through XXXX. 
I was informed this past year by a XXXX representative that it did not matter HOW MUCH I PAY for the XXXX Part D premium, EVERYONE under XXXX, ( one of only 3 XXXX Advantage Plans in XXXX Wisconsin where I live ) pays the out of pocket XXXX Coverage Gap of {$4700.00} out of pocket expense for life saving medications. I would like the CFPB to investigate both Capital One on both my credit card and auto loan interest rates as well as XXXX and what I feel is XXXX fraud under the XXXX Part D program. In addition to the XXXX Part D program for medications, I also pay an annual premium for XXXX Part D of approximately {$130.00} per month PLUS 20 % of any / all XXXX Part B services. Again, XXXX does not pay the full 20 %, thus MORE OUT OF POCKET EXPENSES!!! With a limited fixed income, there is no possible way for me to pay for the high interest rates under Capital One for a credit card and an automobile loan in order to have a reliable mode of transportation in XXXX Wisconsin which has VERY FEW options for medical or non-medical transportation. Thus, the need for one credit card and one reliable vehicle paid for at 25.9 % apr/interest rate. I feel as a XXXX person, I am being discriminated against by both Capital One and XXXX, XXXX Advantage Plan. PLEASE HELP ME!!!!!

Product: Payday loan, title loan, or personal loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I obtained a line of credit from Paypal in the beginning of XXXX to make a singular, particular purchase. Paypal offers a promotion for obtaining credit, " Paypal Credit ''. Right on the webpage, they have this statement : " When you need to buy something, you dont want to wait. With PayPal Credit, you can enjoy special financing offers like this one : No Payments + No Interest if paid in full in 6 months on purchases of {$99.00} or more. Buying with the power to pay as you choose and still enjoying the security and reliability of PayPal ... now thats magic Interest will be charged to your account from the posting date ( which is usually within a few days of the purchase date ) if the purchase balance is not paid in full within 6 months. Subject to credit approval. See terms. 

I made the purchase promptly after obtaining the credit, which the application process had its own disappointing issues. When the statement was made available a few weeks later, I was expecting the promotion details to be stated on the statement. There were no details about my promotion, my charge was listed as a " Standard Purchase ''. It was not clear at first why no details of my promotion were not listed and it wasnt clear to me what a standard purchase was supposed to mean. But on the surface, things seemed ok because this was not a cash advance, it was not a balance transfer, it was an ordinary consumer purchase to a vendor that was conducted online. Inspecting the statement carefully, the fine-print on the back of the statement had language about promotions and deferred interest saying : " There is one type of Deferred Interest Purchase : No Payments + No interest if paid in full in 6 months Purchases : Deferred Interest Purchases on which no payments will be due during the six-month deferred interest period. 
If you pay the balance on a Deferred Interest Purchase in full by the Expiration Date, we will not charge any interest for that Purchase. We will calculate the interest for each Billing Cycle prior to the Expiration Date and disclose it on the billing statement as the Accrued Deferred Interest. If you do not pay the balance in full before the Expiration Date, ( 1 ) we may charge your Account, in the Billing Cycle in which the Expiration Date occurs, interest on that Promotional Purchase from the transaction posting date at an APR of 19.99 %, and ( 2 ) any remaining balance will be treated as a Standard Purchase beginning on the Expiration Date. '' There was also language for a " Standard Purchases '' on the back of the statement, it stated : " You can make a Standard Purchase using this Account by choosing the PayPal Credit Payment System when you make a purchase from a Merchant at a website, by telephone, or at another authorized location. We will extend credit to you, in the amount of the Cost of the Purchase, by paying the Merchant on your behalf. '' So it did not clarify that my purchase would not be interest-deferred and I had no reason to expect that the interest would not be deferred provided I paid the balance in 6 months. 

So I contacted PayPal and they told me that the promotion does NOT apply to my purchase and it was incumbent on me to determine beforehand if this was a " qualifying purchase '' by contacting the vendor. What was clear from the beginning was the statement, With PayPal Credit, you can enjoy special financing offers like this one : No Payments + No Interest if paid in full in 6 months on purchases of {$99.00} or more. What was NOT clear was that purchases are not all considered equal. It was also not clear to me that *I* had to contact the vendor before making the purchase to see if their purchase would apply under another partys financing promotion and terms. That would mean having to contact a third party to find out if the sale of their merchandise qualifies with the bank ( Paypals financing terms ) as a promotional-eligible purchase before even bothering to go through the entire application process for obtaining Paypays credit. But this is also under the assumption that some random vendor would know intimately Paypals policies and processes for extending credit and exactly how their promotions work. That would also be like two complete strangers have agreed to extend credit/financing from one to the other and the second is paying me their money, and I am completely privy to the terms of their lending. Does Paypal not realize that most people are neither mind-readers nor prophetic, even over distances?

So I appealed to the logic that their marketing did not state that only certain purchases or a limited pool of vendors would apply for this promotion. I also pointed out that it was not clear that the client needed to do this research beforehand and it was not logical that the third party would necessarily know Paypals promotional policy. The point that their promotion allowed for deferred interest on the contingency of paying the entire balance within six months was the entire purpose of inquiring for their credit and I asked them to extend the promotion to this on the basis of their ambiguity, calling out the marketing as deceptive effectively impossible to discern as they state. We have gone back and forth a couple times and their responses have been part adamant and part unintelligent as they refuse to acknowledge the ambiguity of the language in their marketing and the statement fine-print.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I was discharged in the United States Bankruptcy Court, XXXX District of Florida, Chapter XXXX. The debt on the condo I had financed through XXXX XXXX XXXX was also discharged.

In the meantime, XXXX XXXX XXXX had released their lien and the property was sold to the condo association via certificate of title for the amount due on HOA fees. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX, who apparently bought the loan from XXXX XXXX XXXX began sending mortgage statements and this showed up on my credit report as unpaid, so I wrote them a letter on XX/XX/XXXX and they removed this from my credit report. 

I then began receiving mortgage statements from XXXX XXXX and called them but they said they would need proof of my bankruptcy, which I faxed to them, but the mortgage statements continued to be mailed. 

Then, XXXX XXXX, a division of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX filed a Complaint against me and the condo association in XX/XX/XXXX, along with a Notice of Lis Pendens seeking to foreclose the mortgage. I filed an answer to the complaint stating that this property was discharged in bankruptcy. The case is ongoing in the XXXX Judicial Circuit Court of XXXX County, Florida, and I do not know what to do from here. I am still receiving mortgage statements for the balance due on a monthly basis. 

Just recently when I pulled into my driveway after work, a server stopped me in front of my home and asked if I would consider a deed in lieu of foreclosure on the property to XXXX XXXX and I told her that I do not own that property, that it was released in bankruptcy in XX/XX/XXXX, and the condo association is now the owner of the property. She asked if she could take a picture of me to prove she had spoken with me and I refused. She did take a picture of the home I currently own after I walked in the door.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I opened a loan with XXXX XXXX in XX/XX/XXXX. I graduated in XX/XX/XXXX and enrolled into one of XXXX XXXX 's loan repayment programs. we paid XXXX a month and the money was always automatically deducted. I noticed statements in the mail with several late fees, miscalculated payments. My loans were all increasing and I noticed several large fees. I called in and was never given a answer. One employee tried telling me i was late every month because the payment was due on the XXXX and the money was withdrawn on the XXXX of every month. XXXX XXXX set this repayment plan up, not me. if the above is even true, they set me up to be late every month. my mother and i sent in XXXX dollars to try and catch up and we received another statement showing we went in the hole XXXX dollars. We went through instances like this for months. I was desperate for help and was calling every company and also different loan companies like XXXX XXXX. No one could help because the loans are private. 
I then was contacted by XXXX XXXX also known as XXXX XXXX XXXX. They noticed I had fraud all over my account, which I already knew. they explained they are helping thousands of other students fight XXXX XXXX who is now Navient. As we all know XXXX XXXX destroyed their name for similiar situations like mine. They were forced to pay back millions and now are Navient. Same terrible company with a different name. I agreed to XXXX to work for me. I had a " lawyer '' i received letters in the mail showing what they sent to Navient. They were working for me and promised nothing but better. I had a online portal where i sent in all information regarding my loans and any issues, i had call logs because during this loan dispute they were to no longer contact me. I received a settlement offer letter from navient, along with a very small check due to an error on fees on their behalf. I was promised my credit would be improved, they offer a credit corrections program. I have saved ALL correspondance with these people. Represenatives who worked for XXXX XXXX XXXX, letters, EVERYTHING. I was notified in may and found out that the entire thing was a scam. I also have been doing deep research and found out Navient is AGAIN being sued for selling thousands of students information to two brothers in florida who posed as a comoany who fights for students and handles these cases. My information was one of them! We paid XXXX every month and lost almost 18,000 dollars to this scam and again this is XXXX fault. How is this company still up in running? How as students are we supposed to pay our loans to the biggest fradulent company in the united states. My credit is ruined. My name is ruined. I have a degree that means nothing to me. It 's a money pit and if I could sell it back i would. Navient has ruined my life. Im almost XXXX years old and ca n't buy a house, ca n't get approved for any loan, and just had to buy my first new car through my father because my credit is ruined. all of it from Navient. My mother and father have always had amazing credit. my mother is my cosigner and now she ca n't be approved, and was n't approved for my car and the 1 and only 1 reason why she was denied, was because of the XXXX dollar debt we have to Navient. I refuse to send another penny to this company until things are right! I have lost thousands and now have been scammed over more thousands and this is all because of them. They were involved on this scam which is also why they are in another current lawsuit. It all seemed so real and its funny because navient stopped calling. they have yet to call me and harrass me to make payments. I have n't paid them in years and they stopped after i was involved with XXXX XXXX XXXX. Then I received the check in the mail from them along with a settlement letter. They were playing along with the scam and why on earth would they submit a settlement offer if this company is innocent and doing everything legal??? 
I refuse to pay a fradulent company. I also need to know where I can mail all my documents, i have made copies and have tons to print and i prefer to mail them. I dont have the time to scan in thousands of documents to the computer and upload. I will print, and fax or mail. so please contact me on who i need to specifically send these to so they can be attached to this case. This a small summary of what this company has done to me in 10 years.

I have tried to close my XXXX XXXX account with XXXX XXXX multiple times. My first time closing the account was at the end of XX/XX/XXXX, and I have tired closing it two additional times this most recent time is last Wednesday XX/XX/XXXX. I have not made a purchase using this card in over a year. The XXXX store no longer exists When closing the account I call the company and they assure me that everything is taken care of. After getting the confirmation over the phone after each account closing conversation, I continue to receive paper billing from XXXX and notifications about due payments. This has repeated itself from XX/XX/XXXX-now. When I receive these notices I call XXXX and they clear the charges and ask for the account to be closed. Then the cycle begins again with me getting notices about account payments. Now, my credit score has been effected. XXXX XXXX has filed a late payment on my credit history and my score has dropped. Not only has this been a nightmare of something to deal with, but now my credit score has dropped. I would like this to be corrected, and I would like to know if I am able to pursue legal action.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I have come to rely on my XXXX XXXX more and more as my health has started to decline. Because of this I have come to rely on the customer service representatives I speak to. I was told about Public Service Loan Forgiveness in the Fall of XXXX. I graduated in XX/XX/XXXX. I worked with XXXX XXXX as my sole source of information to repay my loan. I was lead to believe that I was enrolled in The Loan Forgiveness program beginning in XX/XX/XXXX and I have made payments each month on time. I call each year to make sure I am keeping up with everything I need to do so that my loan with be forgiven. This is very important to me since I am a single mother with a XXXX. 
Several years later, a coworker suggested that I ask about the teacher loan forgiveness program and I did. When I called I asked specifically if this would affect the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program and I was told it would not. I applied for this and it was paid toward my loan. I was told it would reduce the amount of my entire loan and the Public Loan Forgiveness Program would pay less. This {$5000.00} did not benefit me as my entire loan would have been completely forgiven anyway. At this time, I had no information outside of what I was being told. During another call I asked if I needed to complete an application for the Public Service Loan and was told it wasnt necessary until XX/XX/XXXX. I was not told nor sent any information about Public Service Loan Forgiveness to review prior to accepting the Teacher Loan Forgiveness. I found one by chance decided on my own to complete the Employment Certification only after I had completed the XXXX Loan Forgiveness application. This was the first time I had access to any information about Public Service Loan Forgiveness. During this entire process no one mentioned how one impacted the other. 
At some point in time my loan was handed over to XXXX. I have continued to call multiple times each year to make sure I was on track for my loan to be forgiven. I asked specifically in XX/XX/XXXX about my number of payments and was told there was no problem it would be repaid in XX/XX/XXXX. My due diligence was performed when I asked about the teacher loan forgiveness and with each call I have made since XX/XX/XXXX. No one explained that the Teacher Loan Forgiveness would impact the Public Service Loan Forgiveness until I asked about my number of payments in XX/XX/XXXX. After having spoken to XXXX and being told that it was not their fault, I called XXXX XXXX and basically, XXXX claims it was XXXX 's fault that this was not explained to me and vice versa. I requested a customer service supervisor from XXXX to call me on my cell phone and I was never contacted. 
If I had access to information regarding how one impacts the other prior to accepting, I would never have agreed to the XXXX Loan Forgiveness. I asked but was not made aware that the years of service and the number of payments would be affected. In short, five years and 60 payments have been taken from me without my knowledge or consent. I asked this about this directly and was told it would not affect the Public Loan Forgiveness at all. Because I can not rely solely on my vision I counted on what I was told to be the truth. I should have 10 years of public school service as of XX/XX/XXXX with 120 faithfully made payments counted toward forgiveness. If I had been told of these implications, I never would have agreed to the XX/XX/XXXX Loan Forgiveness. This did not benefit me at all.

They told me that I had to call a 3rd party who the processing company was with. They informed me that I could not send it back and that I would now be charge 3 times the amount I was told the machine cost by the branch manager and that I had to pay XXXX dollars to end my contract. My credit score went from XXXX to XXXX because of the credit hits that came from wells fargo and the credit card company. My small business is on the verge of bankruptcy and I am personally struggling because of this. I feel it is unfair for wells fargo to come and solicit my small business for processing and then charge me thousands of dollars in fees and withdrawals without answering as to why or how I can fix this issue.

I paid the modification for several years ( XXXX ) when suddenly PNC decided to return all my mortgage che is ( after mine had been cashed ). I did not cash any of their checks that have been returned and they have stacked up to XXXX. They have since sent me a letter they are going to foreclose on the home and I have decided to file bankruptcy to protect myself against PNC which has since ruined my credit. I have since receive a letter from PNC stating they are going to court to sell the house on XX/XX/XXXX and I have now decided to join a class action lawsuit as I have paid thousands of dollars in attorney fees and no results from local attorney General and courts. Updated on XX/XX/XXXX : This is a follow up from my prior complaint regarding PNC mortgage. PNC foreclosed on my prior account while I was paying my mortgage and has handed my home over for renting to a company out of Utah called XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX. Buyers beware. Do not take out a mortgage with PNC mortgage!!! If you have been ripped off the way I have and not obtaining local help from your local courts and politicians seek class action! This ca n't be legal. Updated XX/XX/XXXX : PNC left me homeless for the holidays and for the XXXX XXXX. Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Trouble with how payments are being handled
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am having a major problem with Navient. I have been faithfully paying and paying extra on my student loans, yet the balance is not going down as it should. Navient keeps mis-applying my payments and making interest-only payments on some of my loans. I have contacted Navient a number of times and have asked for managers/escalation, but they always tell me there is nothing they can do about past allocations, that they can fix it for the future, and we go over how to allocate my payment, then they do it wrong again. 

In XX/XX/XXXX I paid {$16000.00} on my loans. When the year began I had $ XXXX in debt and now my balance is still {$30000.00}. I have paid extra and watched the balance creep down to below $ XXXX and then, even though I am still over-paying - creep back up to above it. There is no one at Navient who can explain this to me! 

On XX/XX/XXXX the balance on one of my four loans was {$14000.00} and XX/XX/XXXX it 's {$14000.00}. I paid {$2800.00} in interest and {$340.00} principal this year. That makes NO sense whatsoever. The interest rate on this loan is 4.625 %. No one at Navient can explain this or help me with this.

I have contacted Santander asking for validation of my debt on XX/XX/XXXX and was told they would send me a copy of my contract within 10 business days which I still have not yet received. Upon checking my credit report there is an address listed that I have never lived at nor do I know where it is located. My credit report changes every month on the amount I owe Santander. The status one month it will show XXXX and the next month it will show XXXX and now it is showing a balance of XXXX, it will also show write off due to bad debt and then it will be changed to late payment and now it is showing closed/ charged off account.

I deposited a check drawn on the same bank into the ATM checking account XX/XX/XXXX. The bank gave me none of the money for immediate use. Now it is XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX and they have still not credited my account. Even though if I physically still had the check, I could walk it right down to the bank and cash or deposit it and get full use of it right this second. So my money right now is lost in the banking system and I have no access to it. What good is the ATM for making deposits if it just going to make it more difficult to gain access to my money. Somethings wrong with this and I have not had any food to eat for over 24 hrs because I ca n't get my money. Please Help

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX must be forthright, must be truthful, must not play games, you must answer this question, you must produce the documentation, you must " PROVE UP ''. 

Occ # XXXX -published Cfpb # XXXX Letter Dated XX/XX/2017 Chase sai the exact ; XXXX funding securitized the loan into a mortgage trust for which XXXX XXXX was the TRUSTEE.

DO NOT CONTACT CHASE.

Today XXXX/XXXX/XXXX, I went online to make a store credit card payment to Walmart. On my paper bill it said go to Walmart.com/credit. I went to the website and it was very difficult to find the link to make a payment. There was a huge advertisement to get a credit card. The link to make a payment was found located very discretely at the bottom of the page. It was difficult to get to the bottom of the page due to the fact the advertisement to apply for a credit card was so huge, as soon as you click the area in error it brings you to a page to apply for a credit card. After registering, I was able to make a payment. I chose the option to pay with a debit card. After giving my debit card information and clicking submit, it did not confirm my payment was made. It did not give a reference number or any expectations. I go back to research and it does not reflect my payment was made. It will allow you to make another payment despite the fact that you just made a payment. I checked my bank account and the amount was taken from my account. I contacted online customer service and explained what happened. The respond that it will take XXXX hours to reflect a payment was made. My concern is that this website was very misleading and should reflect and confirm when your payment has been made. There was no disclosure of what to expect after making my payment. I want to mention I did contact my bank and customer service first before trying to submit another payment, my concern is for those who would have not thought to do that. The website comes off as secretly taking advantage of consumers.

Issue: Problem with a purchase or transfer
Sub-issue: Card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase or transfer
Consumer complaint narrative: I put XXXX on a XXXX XXXX card because Im repairing my credit after a devorce and bankrupsey. For an entire year I never used the card but I kept reading by not using it I was not getting the full bennifit of having the card. So I started using it and at some point XXXX XXXX just changed things by giving me my money back but then using their money. Ok great every month I transferred money paying off the debt and using the money which was showing I could repay the loan. Well all was fine until I lost my card. I replaced the card but still paid my bills by giving my other bank card to XXXX until my new came. I buy money and Im on a payment plan with these companies. Ok I told them my new card with XXXX XXXX but they did not explaine that their computers would have to update. So I put money on the XXXX XXXX card to cover charges but one creditor used my debt card with XXXX  so XXXX took all the money back charged me {$30.00} and the other creditors had interest charges when the funds werent Their with XXXX XXXX. So Im getting nasty messages not going threw. So I hear from XXXX telling me everything would had been ok except this one merchant charged your card and that threw everything off. I said I asked was the amount correct every time before I move money and XXXX said it showed nothing on hold. Ok I said how can you tell me that and yet a unexpected charge comes threw. Then they say some merchants may take funds latter date and it want show! How if you cant see funds on hold how am Im to know whats on hold? The problem is their is no way according to XXXX. Ok I then sent the new available amount from XXXX to XXXX XXXX which went threw. Then once that was ok I sent {$18.00} over to XXXX XXXX just to clear out an account. Ok I check the next day and the computer tells me its still in my XXXX account instead of being in XXXX XXXX so I call XXXX and ask why did it not transfer? She tells me maybe their was a glitch try it again. So I do well that {$18.00} dollars transferred but so did another {$18.00} which was not in the account so XXXX takes back the {$18.00} and charges me another {$30.00} for not enough funds! Im XXXX XXXX Im a XXXX Veteran I dont have money to throw away! XXXX blamed XXXX XXXX for bein the one not taking the funds nice their release! I call XXXX XXXX asking why they arent posting my funds once released from XXXX? They ofcorse blame XXXX ok I transfer {$100.00} it went threw fast! Then I send {$140.00} and I did that in Fri it did not post until after XXXX with XXXX XXXX almost three days. XXXX XXXX said the computer was on Holiday which is why it took that long! Since when do computers go on vacation? But during the conversation she says the account is closed! Im like how can you close a card I opened wit my money so I can use it as I invest in the card? She said I violated the card rules! Then a manager said wad the contract you signed! I did not sign a contract I applied for a unsecured card I put money on much like a debt card! Well I guess thats not what XXXX XXXX calls it but my payment on the card a month s only {$37.00} Im putting way more than that on the card plus their is a balance of {$240.00} on the card! So why close a card m paying on. Im trying to get every creditor to use that card so not to have charge made to my XXXX card any longer. But XXXX XXXX says I can open another account but the one I have now is closed. I think if your paying the card every month they should not close my card. As far as merchants deciding one day oh I owe them and take funds Im unprepared for and the XXXX banks not removing charged money from my available money sucks but I can only go by what the computer says or what those working at the bank tell me is available?? I think I have One nothing wrong I did my part to pay every month on that card I feel I should had received notice of if these issues kee up my account could be closed but I Never was warned and again their is funds on the card its not deliquient so I feel Ive been wronged y XXXX XXXX XXXX.

XX/XX/XXXX SENT VIA EMAIL XXXX & U.S. MAIL XXXX XXXX XXXX , XXXX. 
XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, Georgia XXXX SENT VIA EMAIL XXXX & US MAIL XXXX XXXX , XXXX. 
XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, Georgia XXXX NOTICE TO CEASE AND DESIST EFFORTS TO OBTAIN POSSESSION OF XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, GEORGIA XXXX Dear XXXX XXXX & XXXX, This letter is in response to a letter that I expect to and anticipate receiving shortly from your office. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, the same day that I received a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX from your law partner, XXXX XXXX, I sent you a response letter explaining in detail my position with respect to illegal and unethical foreclosure of the subject property referenced above ( see Exhibits A-B ). 

First, as will be explained in greater detail below, the foreclosure auction involving the subject property that occurred on XX/XX/XXXX is void ab initio for a myriad of reasons, based on civil regulatory violations, criminal conflict of interest, criminal complicity, fraud and other criminal conduct. 

LACK OF STANDING Prior to the foreclosure auction on XX/XX/XXXX, I had previously filed at least two ( 2 ) lawsuits against XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX within the past two ( 2 ) years in XXXX County Superior Court ( later removed to Federal District Court ) related to their improper noticing my home for foreclosure ( please take judicial notice ). 

By virtue of XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX having been a named as a Co-Defendant in multiple lawsuits also naming the Servicer ( XXXX ), Trustee ( XXXX ) and Investor ( XXXX   ), XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, as a law firm, had a conflict of interest and therefore had no standing or authority to conduct the foreclosure sale to begin with. 

FIRST ACT AND COUNT OF CIVIL & REGULATORY VIOLATIONS & CRIMINAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST, CRIMINAL COMPLICITY AND CRIMINAL FRAUD In addition to the Mortgage Servicer ( XXXX ), Trustee ( XXXX ) and purported Investor ( XXXX ) having no standing to foreclose on the subject property to begin because of a continued conflict of interest as described above, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX also did not having standing to foreclose on the subject property as they did not include the name of the true Investor in their notices to myself nor did they disclose such in the required ad they ran in the XXXX XXXX. 

XXXX XXXX, not XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, was and is the actual and true Investor prior to and the time of the foreclosure auction. 

This was confirmed to me by an XXXX employee, XXXX ( last name not provided ) believed to be in the Loss Mitigation Unit at XXXX, Employee ID # XXXX at XXXX XXXX EST on Monday XX/XX/XXXX. 

The concealment of the true investor constitutes an act of fraud in the foreclosure transaction and violates various provisions of Title 44 of the Official Code of Georgia. 

This fact and this fact alone, voids the transaction in its entirety. 
SECOND ACT AND COUNT OF CIVIL & REGULATORY VIOLATIONS & CRIMINAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST, CRIMINAL COMPLICTY AND CRIMINAL FRAUD Second, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX individually and collectively violated numerous provisions of consent orders that they entered into over the past decade with several Federal Agencies, including Consumer Protection Financial Bureau, the Office of Comptroller General, The United States Department of Justice and the Office of Thrift Supervision, well prior to their initiating foreclosure of the subject property. 

In addition, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX violated various rules issued by the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX governing the conditions that must be met before a mortgage company can foreclose, including, but not limited to : 1 ) Demonstrated and Actual Good faith consideration of a homeowners request for loss mitigation options ; 2 ) Full, thorough and good faith consideration of homeowners request for loan modification ; 3 ) Denying a homeowners request for loss mitigation options only if there is a sufficient and articulable basis and reason to do so and ; 4 ) The right of a homeowner to appeal the denial of request for loss mitigation options or loan modification prior to the foreclosure auction. 

XXXX, et al did none of the above and so in addition to XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX  not having standing to foreclose on the subject property because of a conflict of interest, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX, likewise did not have actual or equitable standing to foreclose on the subject property either. 

THIRD ACT AND COUNT OF CIVIL & REGULATORY VIOLATIONS & CRIMINAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST, CRIMINAL COMPLICITY AND CRIMINAL FRAUD On or about XX/XX/XXXX, I received an anonymous letter advising that bid rigging occurred during the foreclosure auction on XX/XX/XXXX. Since your clients, XXXX XXXX, XXXX and XXXX XXXX, XXXX submitted the winning bid, I assume that the bid rigging scheme involved them both. ( see Exhibit C ). 

I notified the XXXX County Clerk of Courts office, the United State Department of Justice and the XXXX County District Attorneys office of this. ( see Exhibits D-E ). 

Assuming that your clients or others engaged in bid rigging during the foreclosure sale, the foreclosure transaction is void from the inception and this is on top of the fraud and conflicts of interest noted above. 

FOURTH ACT AND COUNT OF CIVIL & REGULATORY VIOLATIONS & CRIMINAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST, CRIMINAL COMPLICITY AND CRIMINAL FRAUD Following the removal of the multiple cases I filed against XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX, from XXXX Superior Court to Federal District Court for the XXXX District of Georgia, the cases were assigned to Magistrate Court Judge XXXX XXXX, who unbeknownst to me, was formerly a Partner with the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX who has and still represents XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX and is paid XXXX of dollars each year for doing so. 

Also assigned to the case as the Supervisory Federal Judge, was Judge XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

Rather than Judge XXXX follow standard protocol and recuse herself because of an actual conflict of interest, she chose to remain on the Magistrate Court Judge and proceeded to issue recommendations and rulings adverse to myself and in favor of the Banks, all of which were adopted and mirrored by Judge XXXX final order ( s ) from the Report ( s ) and Recommendations ( s ) from Judge XXXX. 

Suffice it to say, that none of the rulings and orders by Judges XXXX and XXXX are enforceable. On the contrary, as one would expect, all rulings issued by both conflicted Federal Judges are void and unenforceable with Judicial Complaints pending against both for violations of their Judicial Oath and Conduct Prejudicial to the effect and expeditious administration of the courts business. 

Thus, even though these cases in Federal District Court appear to be administratively closed, all are in fact subject to and will in fact be vacated and set aside through Rule 60 of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure because of such conflicts of interest on the part of the Federal Magistrate Court Judge, XXXX XXXX, which were imputed to Judge XXXX. 

Your firms continued involvement in this case is not only constitutes obstruction of justice, but is also tantamount not only to perpetrating a fraud on the court punishable by disbarment, but also constitutes clear and undeniable violations of Bar Rules 1.2 and 8.4 prohibiting an attorney from knowingly assisting a client in the commission of a crime or fraudulent act and conduct on the part of an attorney that involves dishonesty, fraud and deceit. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX cc : XXXX County Clerk of Court XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX County District Attorney XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, United States Attorney ( DC Circuit ) FBI Public Integrity Section

Issue: Money was not available when promised
Consumer complaint narrative:
I requested a Wire Transfer Withdrawal from Coinbase.com on XX/XX/XXXX for {$2400.00}, and it showed as completed in my Coinbase Account History the same day. 

The reference code for the request is XXXX and the reference code for the wire transaction in history shows as XXXX in Coinbase. 

Yet, I have not received the money in my bank account. My bank said there has not been any incoming wire activity recently. I have my bank statement attached, showing all activity from XX/XX/XXXX to present. There has not been an incoming wire transfer from Coinbase. 

I requested this wire transfer before the site said there would be delays with wire transfers. It has been 11 business days now. At first, they made a status update on XX/XX/XXXX that wire transfers will be delayed by 3 business days. Then on XX/XX/XXXX, they said 5 business day delays. Then on XX/XX/XXXX, they said 7-10 business day delays. 

I have opened numerous support tickets, contacted Coinbase employees on social media and XXXX, yet none of them resolved my issue or even acknowledged it. 

I have done many successful wire transfer withdrawals and ACH withdrawals with this same bank account on Coinbase, so it is not user error. The attached statement shows that I did successfully receive an ACH withdrawal from Coinbase on XX/XX/XXXX for a different transaction ( proving that they have my correct account ).

Sub-issue: Didn't receive terms that were advertised
Consumer complaint narrative:
I opened an account with M & T Bank on XX/XX/XXXX after speaking with a Teller at their XXXX XXXX  branch who informed me that they were running a {$200.00} promotion to open a new account using the code XXXX. Since I was a XXXX resident she stated that I would qualify for the code and that I should come back to open an account or open one online. Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
After reviewing my credit report, I found that my account had a medical obligation from XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX for {$210.00}. I am very aware of any payments that are due and make timely payments, so I was shocked to see this account. 

I do not recall any contractual relationship I had with this organization and all of my medical bills are normally paid by my insurance. 

In my attempts to find out more from this organization, I found out that this company is not bonded in the state of Texas according to Section 392.101. It prohibits a third party debt collector or credit bureau from engaging in debt collection in Texas unless the third-party debt collector or credit bureau has obtained a surety bond and filed a copy of the bond with the office of the Secretary of State. XXXX XXXX XXXX state that they are associated with another company but no designation of this fact is shown in the State of Texas database. Also the company failed to provide information supporting their claim. 

According to the FDCPA, the organization is to validate the debt, but I have not received the documents necessary to prove that this organization is owed the alleged obligation. I 've tried to work this situation out with the third-party collector and no information was forwarded. I needed to see an Exclamation of Benefits ( EOB ) and also a signed document showing proof of services provided to me. XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX failed to provide the information but it in violation by ruining my credit by putting on my credit report an unsupported tradeline. I tried to get information from this organization via the Better Business Bureau and received no information to this date. 

I request that XXXX, Equifax and XXXX remove this tradeline from my credit report as the organization in question has not provided information to support their claims of indebtedness, collection, or ownership.

Issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers
Sub-issue: Confusing or misleading advertising about the credit card
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX XXXX I opened a XXXX XXXX XXXX card which advertised an annual {$300.00} travel credit benefit. On XXXX XXXX, XXXX I used the card for a travel purchase and received a {$300.00} credit from Chase on the same day. Given it happened within XXXX I believed the credit should be counted towards XXXX and I would be eligible for the credit again for XXXX. However, after I used the card multiple times for travel purposes in XXXX I did n't receive any credit. On XXXX XXXX, XXXX, I contacted Chase about the issue. The customer representative explained the XXXX XXXX, XXXX travel purchase and the corresponding {$300.00} credit in fact counted towards XXXX because even though they happened within XXXX they appeared in XXXX XXXX statement. 
At the time of opening the account, I did not receive any explanation that a difference between the date of a transaction and the date such transaction appears on the statement would have a critical impact on how the travel credit would be applied. Such subtle difference, even disclosed clearly, would be extremely confusing for a consumer to understand and manage. Such misleading advertisement directly led to my financial loss.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: Bank of America closed my checking account XX/XX/XXXX which I thought was only for a negative balance. I later find out they closed my account for fraud which Ive never committed. The account balance was {$38.00} which I paid on XX/XX/XXXX. I talked to multiple representatives at Bank of America on XX/XX/XXXX and not one could pull up information about fraud being committed. I completely understand that my account may have been closed due to a negative balance, but Im being reported for something thats completely inaccurate. Fraud and insufficient funds are 2 total completely different things. After trying to resolve the issue I spoke with XXXX and XXXX XXXX  trying to get the issue taken care of. I spoke with a representative at XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX and told him my issue how Im being misreported as fraud. He basically told me he knows and Bank of America risk department reports EVERYBODY as fraud even if they havent committed any type of fraud and if I dispute its a waste of time because XXXX works for the banks not the people. He later told me also if I wanted it removed I would have to wait 5 years or pay {$400.00}. I then called XXXX XXXX about the situation and they told me to file a dispute which I received the documents in my email XX/XX/XXXX. This entire time Ive been misreported and its completely unfair to me because I cant get no type of Bank accts. All of them see me as fraud when Ive never done such a thing. I paid the {$38.00} that I indeed owe and I just want things to be done fairly. Yes I owed on a negative balance, no I didnt commit fraud. I called Bank of America risk department today ( XX/XX/XXXX ) to see if they updated XXXX and XXXX XXXX so I could pursue getting me a new account with a better bank who doesnt just reports every account closure as fraud. The lady told me even though I paid, this account will stay reported as fraud until XX/XX/XXXX. I  then told her that Ive never committed fraud and its reporting inaccurately. She told me that I shouldve filed a claim after the account was closed. I wouldve indeed filed a claimed if the account was closed to fraud, but I was under the impression that my acct was only closed because I had a negative balance of {$38.00}. Nobody at Bank of America can tell me how I committed fraud but theyve reported me. This is completely unfair and its causing unnecessary stress in my life because Im being reported for something that I didnt do. XXXX and XXXX XXXX are working with the banks so its basically 3 against 1. Ive never committed fraud and Bank of America is violating my rights. I demand some type of physical or legal proof showing I committed fraud, if not I need this misreported information removed immediately. Its at the point now where its affecting my daily life because I cant get another bank acct anywhere. If theres no proof where I committed fraud, I need to be removed from XXXX and XXXX XXXX immediately. Like I stated earlier, having an negative account and committing fraud are 2 completely different things.

Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
This complaint is to inform you that I recently viewed my credit report and noticed a collections account from Trident Asset Management on my credit report. I have n't been notified of this collection. On XXXX XXXX, 2017, I sent a certified, return receipt, Debt Validation letter to Trident Asset Management. I advised them that I recently viewed my credit report and noticed a collections account from their company and I have n't been notified of this collection. I stated that this did not imply that I refused to pay this alleged debt. Rather, I would like to dispute their claim. As per the FDCPA, I have the right to request a validation of this debt. I requested for them to prove that I am indeed the party who is by contract obligated to pay off this debt. Reporting any invalidated information to major credit bureaus may constitute defamation of character as a negative listing on my credit report does not allow me to enjoy the benefits of good credit. Non compliance of this request Is likely to put their company in serious legal trouble with the Federal Trade Company ( FTC ) and other statewide agencies. 

I requested that they send me the following documents : 1. ) Agreement with their client that authorize them to collect on this alleged debt. 
2. ) Agreement that bears signature of the allege debtor wherein promises to pay the creditor. 
3. ) Complete payment history on this account to prove that the debt amount they wish to collect is correct. 


I receive a letter from them dated XX/XX/17 advising that I have 30 days to dispute the validity of the debt. The following week, I received a copy of an old XXXX bill from Trident Asset Assessment. An old bill does n't validate and/or prove that this alleged debt is mine. I 've since sent a method of validation letter to the credit bureaus. I 've requesting the information used to " validate '' this alleged debt as a copy of a bill does NOT validate a debt. 

Under the FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681i, all invalidated accounts must be promptly deleted. Therefore, if they are unable to provide me with a copy of the validated proof then they must remove these accounts from my credit report.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Consumer complaint narrative:
I received an email regarding two payments received by CITI. At the time I was expecting and received record of my {$300.00} payment made, received, and cleared. I was then latter informed once during email of a 3rd party {$500.00} payment made to my account. I immediately informed CITI about this. I requested an investigation. Numerous managers at CITI informed me that BOTH the XXXX and the XXXX were legit according to the investigation. 

On or about XX/XX/XXXX CITI falsified documentation on my online statements by placing a Payment Correction of {$500.00}, and at that very time was opposite of what numerous members of their alleged management team informed me upon my own asking ( that the credits, both were legit credits ). 

Just finding out more info today that the {$500.00} in actuality was an error on CITI 's part as they informed me that ( the scenario was another client had made a {$500.00} payment to their account and the payment inadvertently got placed on mine. 

Banks make Errors, Customer make errors. In this case ( 2 ) people at known were impacted ; myself, and the other alleged client based on the information received today XX/XX/XXXX upon my own calling and research. 

CITI recognized that 3rd party payments are a real thing and do happen. I will admit I have made payments to my mothers credit card, and siblings. We all do it, and you probably have done for a family member as well. The fact is I was TOLD verbally by CITI managers on numerous calls that the ( 2 )  credits were legit. At the time there was an over {$400.00} ( CREDIT showing on my account ) because I tend to keep my credit card balances LOW. 

CITI negatively impacted my financial credit score 's utilization which negatively impacts my overall credit score. 

I have a pristine history of paying ontime, and IN FULL as a matter of fact. I deserve even lower APR but that will come soon enough as I manage things very very well. 

CITI pushed my hand with this issue. They initiated the ERROR in the first place. They lied to me the consumer about the facts of the investigation and the result, and never at anytime did CITI notify except with one email that I will share. They have my contact info phone, mail address, email address, secure messaging on their website, but at NO TIME did anyone from CITI contact, or do their job.

They negatively impacted my health as my landlord recently passed, my transmission is failing on my car this days after having to buy new tires for my car. I am XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. You think it is ok for you to just perform financial actions without my legal permission and you think it is ok for you to FAIL to NOTIFY ME? 

Thats not ok. 
This is NOT ok. 
Citi admittedly made an ERROR, and they 're making me pay UNFAIRLY for it. All the time negatively impacting my credit score -- all which I am working on a financial matter that required good behavior on my credit score but CITI is screwing that up, and yet I repeat without notifying the customer. I seriously have no else but to say, XXXX is wrong with CITI. How can they legally falsify/change/redact statements? How can they perform an action which their Fraud department maybe should have followed up with me, or atleast someone but NO ONE DID. 

All this negatively impacted my birthday XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX. This WAS UNFAIR! Put yourself in MY SHOES and you 'll maybe feel the heat coming off of me as to how grossly I am being treated in this mistake that CITI made. Shame on CITI, SHAME on CITI!

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX CA XXXX PHH Mortgage Services XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, NJ XXXX XXXX XXXX, 2018 Regarding : Loan Number XXXX Dear CFPB, The mortgage escrow statement is missing the subject property address. I received a mortgage escrow statement accompanied by a large check. I called the mortgage company PHH to see if they missed one of my insurance renewal payments. Some of my properties have more than one insurance policy. After three ten minute holds a consumer service rep verified my information. She verified my full name, mailing address, loan number and social security number but then would not verify the property address associated with the loan number and mortgage escrow statement I had received and was calling about. I explained I have more than one loan with PHH and I did not know which property this statement was concerning. Without knowing what property we are talking about we could not have an intelligent conversation about any propertys insurance renewal payments. 

I asked to speak with a supervisor and was told no one was available. I was told a supervisor would call me back within 24 hours. No one has ever called me back. The statement shows last years insurance was {$1300.00} and this year they only expect to pay {$590.00}, you would think that would raise concern. 

So now I am in a position where I do not know if the insurance on one of my properties will be renewed. I will only be able to find out after the policy has lapsed and my insurance company sends me a notice of non-renewal for lack of payment. PHH will possibly leave me in a position of great loss if my property is uninsured. The idea they will not tell me which property they missed the insurance renewal payment on is nothing short of negligence. 

I look forward to your assistance with this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

This morning for the 3rd and FINAL time in the last 2 years I attempted to use my debit card only to have it be declined. After several more attempts I broke down and called their customer service. For the third time I was informed that my debit card was stopped/canceled over suspected fradulent activity 0 notice was given. No email. No phone call. No letter. Nothing. Just canceled. And not only did they cancel it, but on the 2 previous occasions that they did the identical thing. I specifically told them DO NOT flag, or do anything else with my card. If I somehow get my card stolen for the first time in my 35 year life I promise Ill give them a call. Otherwise, if I go to use my card. It should work. Every single time. Seems like a pretty simple concept. But apparently thats just too much to ask. So after sitting though 20 minutes of hold time. And another 10 minutes getting a card sent. I hung up thoroughly angry. I set out to open a new account elsewhere and I when i opened my email I noticed a message from capital one stating I could get their mobile app and have access to a digital copy of the card being issued to use online. WONDERUL I thought! Exactly what I needed. I hurried. Downloaded the App and started searching. 20 minutes, multiple XXXX  searches, and 0 progress later I again called. Thinking surely Im just missing it. 20 more minutes on hold. I explain the situation to the representitive. I tell him i received the email. I go over step by step on speaker opening the app. He then puts me on hold for another 10 minutes. Gets back on the phone and informs me, This is a pilot program and we believe you recieved the email in error. You arent eligible or able to get the card information online. So 2 hours of my time GONE. Over sheer incompetence with 0 fault of my own. The policies are a joke. The website is so incredibly jumbled and unintuitive to navigate. And as if to mock me, I was selected in error to get my card.
