Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I noticed that this company is reporting inaccurate data - such as : REPORTING AN ACCOUNT AS A COLLECTION ACCOUNT MULTIPLE MONTHS IN A ROW WHEN AN ACCOUNT CAN ONLY GO INTO COLLECTIONS ONE TIME. NOT 4 TO 24 MONTHS IN A ROW LIKE YOU ARE REPORTING IT!!! AND NOT AS A BRAND NEW COLLECTION EACH MONTH ... YOU HAVE REPORTED THESE ACCOUNT INACCURATELY LONG ENOUGH. RE-AGING OF AN ACCOUNT IS A MISREPRESENTATION OF MY CREDIT HISTORY. PLEASE DELETE THESE ACCOUNTS NOW!!!! PLEASE!!!!! I have fully researched my rights and found that the Fair Credit Reporting Act does not allow you to victimize innocent credit worthy people by reporting erroneous false information. Under the FCRA, the following applies to me 2011 Louisiana Laws Civil Code CC 3494 Actions subject to a three-year prescription Universal Citation : LA Civ Code 3494 SECTION 2. THREE YEAR PRESCRIPTION Art. 3494. Actions subject to a three-year prescription The following actions are subject to a liberative prescription of three years : ( 1 ) An action for the recovery of compensation for services rendered, including payment of salaries, wages, commissions, tuition fees, professional fees, fees and emoluments of public officials, freight, passage, money, lodging, and board ; ( 2 ) An action for arrearages of rent and annuities ; ( 3 ) An action on money lent ; ( 4 ) An action on an open account ; and ( 5 ) An action to recover underpayments or overpayments of royalties from the production of minerals, provided that nothing herein applies to any payments, rent, or royalties derived from state-owned properties. Acts 1986, No. 1031, 1. civil code sec. 2 art. 3494 Louisiana. Also I would like to state you keep deleting accounts and then the creditors add them back to my credit and re-age debts that are in fact 3 + years older and also none of the creditors are registered in the state of Louisiana. The following accounts listed on my credit as follows : XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX has two accounts that they have been re-aging. In the state that I reside, the law states that a debt can only be collected for three years and said debt can not be re-aged and/or reported as open per FCRA rules and guidelines. I also did not receive services from this company and would like them to provide proof of these services or remove them from my reporting. Ive also added my FCRA guidelines that apply to me as well 611. Procedure in case of disputed accuracy [ 15 U.S.C. 1681i ] 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information ( A ) In general. If, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation ; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. B ) Requirements Relating to Reinsertion of Previously Deleted Material ( i ) Certification of accuracy of information. If any information is deleted from a consumer 's file pursuant to subparagraph ( A ), the information may not be reinserted in the file by the consumer reporting agency unless the person who furnishes the information certifies that the information is complete and accurate. ( ii ) Notice to consumer. If any information that has been deleted from a consumer 's file pursuant to subparagraph ( A ) is reinserted in the file, the consumer reporting agency shall notify the consumer of the reinsertion in writing not later than 5 business days after the reinsertion or, if authorized by the consumer for that purpose, by any other means available to the agency. ( iii ) Additional information. As part of, or in addition to, the notice under clause ( ii ), a consumer reporting agency shall provide to a consumer in writing not later than 5 business days after the date of the reinsertion ( I ) a statement that the disputed information has been reinserted ; ( II ) the business name and address of any furnisher of information contacted and the telephone number of such furnisher, if reasonably available, or of any furnisher of information that contacted the consumer reporting agency, in connection with the reinsertion of such information ; and ( III ) a notice that the consumer has the right to add a statement to the consumer 's file disputing the accuracy or completeness of the disputed information. ( C ) Procedures to prevent reappearance. A consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to prevent the reappearance in a consumer 's file, and in consumer reports on the consumer, of information that is deleted pursuant to this paragraph ( other than information that is reinserted in accordance with subparagraph ( B ) ( i ) ). ( D ) Automated reinvestigation system. Any consumer reporting agency that compiles and maintains files on consumers on a nationwide basis shall implement an automated system through which furnishers of information to that consumer reporting agency may report the results of a reinvestigation that finds incomplete or inaccurate information in a consumer 's file to other such consumer reporting agencies. ( 6 ) Notice of Results of Reinvestigation ( A ) In general. A consumer reporting agency shall provide written notice to a consumer of the results of a reinvestigation under this subsection not later than 5 business days after the completion of the reinvestigation, by mail or, if authorized by the consumer for that purpose, by other means available to the agency. ( B ) Contents. As part of, or in addition to, the notice under subparagraph ( A ), a consumer reporting agency shall provide to a consumer in writing before the expiration of the 5-day period referred to in subparagraph ( A ) ( i ) a statement that the reinvestigation is completed ; ( ii ) a consumer report that is based upon the consumer 's file as that file is revised as a result of the reinvestigation ; ( iii ) a  notice that, if requested by the consumer, a description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information shall be provided to the consumer by the agency, including the business name and address of any furnisher of information contacted in connection with such information and the telephone number of such furnisher, if reasonably available ; ( iv ) a notice that the consumer has the right to add a statement to the consumer 's file disputing the accuracy or completeness of the information ; and ( v ) a notice that the consumer has the right to request under subsection ( d ) that the consumer reporting agency furnish notifications under that subsection. ( 7 )  Description of reinvestigation procedure. A consumer reporting agency shall provide to a consumer a description referred to in paragraph ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ) by not later than 15 days after receiving a request from the consumer for that description. ( 8 ) Expedited dispute resolution. If a dispute regarding an item of information in a consumer 's file at a consumer reporting agency is resolved in accordance with paragraph ( 5 ) ( A ) by the deletion of the disputed information by not later than 3 business days after the date on which the agency receives notice of the dispute from the consumer in accordance with paragraph ( 1 ) ( A ), then the agency shall not be required to comply with paragraphs ( 2 ), ( 6 ), and ( 7 ) with respect to that dispute if the agency ( A ) provides prompt notice of the deletion to the consumer by telephone ; ( B ) includes in that notice, or in a written notice that accompanies a confirmation and consumer report provided in accordance with subparagraph ( C ), a statement of the consumer 's right to request under subsection ( d ) that the agency furnish notifications under that subsection ; and ( C ) provides written confirmation of the deletion and a copy of a consumer report on the consumer that is based on the consumer 's file after the deletion, not later than 5 business days after making the deletion. With this being said Im aware of my rights. Please do whats right and delete and make sure these stay off my reports. Thank you, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have a mortgage loan with Pacific Union Financial LLC. This was a VA loan that I closed on in XX/XX/XXXX. I called XXXX XXXX customer service that following year in XX/XX/XXXX to ask them to increase my escrow amount given that the first years taxes were on my land value only and did not include my improvements ( my property ). I had an estimated bill from my county that showed the new escrow amount but they would not allow the increase. I then asked if I could send them extra funds so that there would be a sufficietn amount in escrow to pay taxes at which time they stated that any extra money would be applied to principal only. Given this outcome, I was forced to wait until XXXX XXXX paid my taxes at which time my account is now in the negative {$3000.00}. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I recieved an escrow analysis detailing this event and was given two options : 1. Do nothing and my mortgage increases to {$2700.00} from {$1900.00} and 2. Pay {$5500.00} and my mortgage payment increases to {$2300.00}. The problem with either scenario is that XXXX XXXX is requesting I overfund my account by over {$2500.00} dollars ; money in which they will have to return to me within 30 days according to 12 CFR 1024.17 ( f ). I called XXXX XXXX on two occasions to ask for a reanalysis and on my second call I spoke with a supervisor XXXX ID # XXXX. XXXX informed me that she understood the law but stated that it is XXXX XXXX 's proceedures to have a " cushion. '' I again explained that it is against the law for them to keep a surplus amount above the amount for my taxes and insurance needs and need the mortgage amount changed. XXXX explained that this could not happen. I then asked XXXX what would happen if I paid the {$3000.00} decficit then paid {$2300.00} and she stated that would be a partial payment and my account would be in default. Please note, my principal and interest payment is only {$1800.00} a month.

Issue: Problem with a lender or other company charging your account
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX my purse was stolen including my driver 's license, credit/atm cards, checkbook and keys. I reported the theft and it is in a XXXX Police Report. I cancelled my Bank of America ( BOA ) cards, stopped payment on the missing checks, and removed most of the funds from my checking account. 

On XX/XX/XXXX-XX/XX/XXXX, three deductions totaling {$5500.00} were made from the BOA checking account belonging to my husband and me for " returned item chargeback ''. Apparently, on XX/XX/XXXX-XX/XX/XXXX, someone presented my stolen id, and BOA cashed 3 third party checks totaling {$5500.00}. This was despite the fact that there were not sufficient funds in the checking account to cover any one of the third party checks. 

On XX/XX/XXXX-XX/XX/XXXX, we met with a local BOA official who initiated a BOA fraud investigation, referencing the XXXX Police Report number. He put a " fraud hold '' on the account, and we discussed options for my safety deposit boxes since the thief had both my id and my deposit box keys. Ultimately, I re-keyed both boxes. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I was contacted by the BOA fraud investigator. I told her that my TX driver 's license was stolen which displayed my signature, along with checks, cards, etc. I also referred her to a second identity theft incident using my cancelled checks and gave the XXXX County report number. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, without any communication, BOA move funds from savings accounts of ourselves and our child to cover the overdraft in the checking account. I met with a BOA official at a local branch, who indicated that the fraud claim was denied, but that she initiated a " reconsideration request ''. She said they would email me the denial letter, which they did not do. 

After several calls to BOA check fraud, I received the denial letter which stated " The signature on the item ( s ) you claimed matches with the sample signature ( s ) on the account. Based on our research, identification belonging the account holder was used and we have n't been advised that your identification was lost or stolen. '' Between XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, we contacted BOA at least 9 times via the fraud department customer phone lines, letters, and local BOA officials. We provided full copies of the XXXX Police and XXXX County reports. BOA continues to delay citing workload, errors in internal communication and work processes, lack of information, adherence to internal durations, etc. On XX/XX/XXXX, the representative indicated that the first reconsideration request was not done correctly, and did not take place, so he provided the proper paperwork, and now the completion date was XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, another representative indicated that there were 2  reconsideration requests, that the first one was denied but there would be no communication to me, to call back after XX/XX/XXXX.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX I called the Member Service number listed on my credit card statement for XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, because the interest amount charged of {$47.00} was excessive, it calculates to an annual rate of 51 % instead of the stated 23.99 % on the statement. After over 1 hour 30 minutes on the phone, most of it on hold I was told the Balance Subject to Interest Rate was claimed to be {$2400.00}, which was nearly 1.5 times the actual balance of {$1100.00} for the month interest was to be charged. My payment is usually due on the XX/XX/XXXX of the month. I typically pay my balance in full so there is no interest charged. In XX/XX/XXXX, the month the interest was charged I missed the payment date and paid two days late due to thinking I had set up the payment the previous week. The interest charge I am challenging does NOT include the late fee. That fee is legitimate but the interest charge is not. The balance due on XX/XX/XXXX was {$1100.00}. Even if the credit card company abuses the consumer with a two month calculation that still doesnt justify the interest charge. The balance due in XX/XX/XXXX was {$510.00}. The company refused to explain the calculation, there is no rational way to figure out how they exploit the customer and manipulate the effective interest rate to be far in excess of the claimed interest rate. After one hour and 45 minutes another representative came on the phone and continued to argue the rate and still refused to explain how they were fraudulently calculating my interest charge. After 2 hours and 1 minute I put the phone down and ignored the lying and dismissive attitude until the representative hung up. It became abundantly clear that there was no interest by the company to be honest and forthright regarding their fraudulent manipulation of balances. I will be making my payment due XX/XX/XXXX on time but I expect a new exorbitant interest charge on my statement due XX/XX/XXXX. In the fine print on the back of the statement it says the bank calculates the Balance Subject to Interest Rate by using an average daily balance method. It explains that calculation uses the daily balances during the billing cycle. Using that method it would still be impossible to achieve the Balance Subject to Interest Rate of {$2400.00} unless they are using the balance from the NEXT month. Because remember the previous months balance due, paid on the XX/XX/XXXX, the month before month the interest was due for was {$510.00}. Assuming that I made one charge of {$1100.00} on the first day of the billing cycle due on XX/XX/XXXX, the whole balance would still only be {$1600.00}, or roughly 2/3 of the claimed Balance Subject to Interest Rate of {$2400.00}. The bank refused to do anything to correct their error.

The offer said that if I get the card and spent {$3000.00} in the first 3 months that I would get 50,000 bonus miles for XXXX XXXX. I applied for the card in XXXX of 2016 and I was approved. I called in to Chase Bank to see if I would qualify for the offer and they said I would get the offer. I spent more than the {$3000.00} limit to the get the offer. I canceled the card and chase told me that the miles would expire in 2 years. After my account was canceled my miles disappeared. I have been trying to work with Chase to get these miles back but they said that m account was purged. I did nothing wrong and now chase will not work with me to resolve this issue. The account number on this closed account was XXXX. I have also received a letter from Chase saying that I was supposed to receive the bonus. I will attach that as well.

Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative: I have been getting phone calls by various locations several times a day back to back to back. I do n't answer random numbers so I blocked some and just let others ring for weeks. After about two months i decided to answer it and it was my Bank ( Bank Of America ) calling from an automated line and I was furious after finding out that it was an automated line blowing up my phone for months. This was a call to collect a debt. I was so confused what I was in debt for so I called the number they gave me. I 'm always so scared to fall behind on my credit card which is why I set up automatic payments to come straight out of my XXXX debit card to pay my BOA credit card. So I decided to call and after waiting on hold for 10 mins they had told me that my credit card is almost {$700.00} past due. How is this possible when my credit card limit is only {$500.00}. I should have only only had about a {$200.00} balance on this card. They never told me that those automatic payments expire after a year. They had all the wrong information in there system. They had the wrong address so I was not getting the statements to be warned I was missing payments. The lady I spoke with had told me I can have these late fees waived and I said yes absolutely, however i would have to pay the initial {$200.00} balance before waiving the fees. I paid the balance off and updated my info in the system and she said I would get my new statement in about a week. I finally got it today which was about three weeks later and it still says I owe {$350.00}. Futhermore they set up my automatic payments again to start paying for the late charges. The fees were never waived and I dont think it is very fair that I owe them this money when I received zero notification of the late fees and the fact that my automatic payments expired. Not to mention in the process of this they revoked this credit card, so I have no credit card anymore and they still expect me to pay these fees when Ive already paid what ive used on the card.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Old information reappears or never goes away
Consumer complaint narrative:
In CFPB Filing # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX stated that they CAN summarily make changes to a Mortgage without the PRIMARY signatories signature, by virtue of a Divorce Decree. In the Divorce Decree between myself and XXXX XXXX XXXX is a SPECIAL WARRANTY DEED, which is NOT THE same as a Quit Claim Deed. I have checked this with several Lawyers and even with the FBI. So, instead of fixing the problem, XXXX decides to CLOSE the offending case file, then open a NEW ONE, again without my signature. So, since XXXX XXXX XXXX can not pay on time, it shows up on my credit report. This is getting very tiresome, and this is exactly what XXXX XXXX was fined XXXX of dollars for, opening accounts without permission from those people. I want this stopped immediately. 

This is their response for Complaint # XXXX : We 've been unable to establish contact with you regarding you concerns about the credit reporting of your account. A Divorce Decree and/or Special Warranty Deed may transfer title to the property, but it does n't affect the original terms of the Note. Since you 're a customer under the Note, we 'll continue to report this account under your name to the consumer reporting agencies. On XX/XX/XXXX, we mailed you a notice that we were making a change to our servicing system. We did not open a new account for your loan, we simply moved your existing account to another servicing system within XXXX XXXX. Effective XX/XX/XXXX, your loan number changed from XXXX to XXXX. The account is currently due for the XX/XX/XXXX payment. 

I have never been contacted with any of this information. Ever. I am willing to submit my home phone number logs ( XXXX ) XXXX or my cell phone logs ( XXXX ) XXXX as evidence in Federal Court to prove that they never bothered to attempt contact. As I am a Federal Law Enforcement Officer, they have committed a Felony under 18 USC 1001. XXXX XXXX continually commits the exact same type of Fraud that they were convicted of in Federal Court. Also, they FAIL TO MENTION that they CHANGED the note WITHOUT my signature or consent, their OWN paperwork shows where my SIGNATURE is REQUIRED, yet they changed the NOTE at that point. 

The CFPB seriously needs to investigate this. I have contacted the FBI and XXXX concerning this matter. They have BOTH said what XXXX is doing is ILLEGAL yet it does not meet their threshold for prosecutions. The CFPB needs to investigate and prosecute XXXX. XXXX can not have it both ways they can not deem my rights as primary signor null and void, materially modify the terms of the mortgage, and then set up a new mortgage account all the while telling me that I am still responsible for the note that is not the original note that I signed.

I went online to register the gift card online as instructed on the back of the card. I discovered that fraudulent charges were applied to my card, which was surprising because the card had been in my possession the whole time. 
I immediately called customer service ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) to inform the company and file a dispute in order to get the funds returned to my card. However, each time I called the company I was given different information as to what I needed to fax over and each time I faxed documents over I was told that those faxes had not been received and I needed to fax additional documents. ( See Attachments ) After the third call to them I was told that my account was closed because I did n't call within the 120 days from the first fraudulent charge. However, there was nothing in the advertisement that stated this but in order to get some consideration I must send another fax requesting the Letter of Consideration. In the end, I am constantly given the run around, always with different and various instructions. It is as if they were hoping that I will finally give up from frustrations of consistently getting the " run around.

Consumer complaint narrative: Please accept this final written OFFER OF SETTLEMENT BEFORE LITIGATION as my attempt to amicably resolve your continued willful violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act regarding your refusal to delete all of the UNVERIFIED account information from my consumer file. Despite my three written requests, the unverified items listed below still remain on my credit report in violation of Federal Law. In the results of your re-investigations, you stated to the Creditor Bureaus that you verified that these items are being reported correctly? You still have not identified who in your company verified the accuracy of these accounts or how they verified them? As previously pointed out to you, XXXX Law Dictionary, 6th Edition, 1990, defines Verification as, Confirmation of correctness, truth or authenticity, by affidavit, oath, or deposition. Affidavit of truth of a matter stated and object of verification is to assure good faith in averments or statements of a party. What this means is that your company must be willing and able to produce a document that proves the account ( s ) in dispute belong to me and the information being reported is accurate and you must be able to do this in a court of law. Someone in your company must authenticate the documents in your files that were used to verify the disputed accounts and to do this they must have 1st hand knowledge of the alleged account ( s ) and all that has ever transpired for the alleged account ( s ), under oath and under the penalty of perjury. Your failure to provide me with verifiable proof required for your company to post the accounts listed below is evidence that it does not exist and therefore is proof that you cant properly Verify the accuracy of any of the disputed accounts. Please be advised that under Section 611 ( 5 ) ( A ) of the FCRA you are required to promptly DELETE all information which can not be verified.

I requested validation in writing from the company and submitted a disputed verbally. I received one paper that looked like a receipt. I did not receive anything showing that I had been treated, no original documentation with my signature, no account number, or that I had been treated to incur this debt. I also disputed this with XXXX, and was told that the agency had clicked a button stating that it was my account and that was good enough. NO DOCUMENTATION has EVER been provided because I was not seen, this company is reporting fraudulent information and it needs to be removed. I will report this fraudulent action to every government agency I can until practices like these are stopped. Tis company gives other legitimate collection companies a bad name.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to respond to XXXX XXXX of First National Bank of Omaha 's response to our complaint regarding XXXX XXXX XXXX credit card with the bank ( CFPB Case No. XXXX ) regarding our request that {$11000.00} in gambling charges and fees be removed from XXXX XXXX XXXX account. In her response, XXXX says that " these transactions occurred from XXXX XXXX through XXXX XXXX, when you closed the account '' and that " during the time the charges in question were being made by XXXX XXXX, neither you nor XXXX XXXX sought to terminate XXXX XXXX ability to use the account, or informed FNBO of any concerns about the charges XXXX XXXX was making. Rather, the billing statements that reflected these charges were consistently paid. '' I did not know until the fall of XXXX, when I came to XXXX, TX to review my mother 's finances and put her in XXXX XXXX, that she even had a credit card with you, let alone that her grandson was using it. As soon as I found out what was going on, I closed the account, telling your company that I strongly suspected fraud on XXXX XXXX XXXX part, and I also asked for a copy of past billing statements. After I received the billing statements from XXXX XXXX to XXXX XXXX, I reviewed them and discovered over 250 mysterious charges that we determined where from offshore illegal gambling companies. Once we were able to ascertain what the charges were and totaled them up, we talked to your company on the phone about them, but were told you would n't remove these illegal gambling charges. After that, we submitted a claim with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau on XXXX XXXX, XXXX with Case No. XXXX. 

FNBO 's position is that, according to the response they provided for this claim on XXXX XXXX, XXXX to CFPB, " FNBO relies on payment system operator policies and procedures designed to thwart unlawful Internet gambling. The UIGEA does not obligate FNBO to police proactively for potential illegal activities underlying charges made on credit card accounts. '' However, according to your own deposit agreement as seen at https : //www.firstnational.com/common/iws/pdf/deposit_agreement.pdf, you say on Page 25 of the document that " You agree not to use your account for unlawful internet gambling. We may block any Transaction that we identify as a restricted Transaction under the Unlawful Internet Gambling Enforcement Act of 2006 or other applicable law. '' On Page 32 of that agreement, FNBO also says that cardholders " agree not to use your card to engage in illegal activity or online gambling. '' It says nothing there about relying on " payment system operator policies and procedures designed to thwart unlawful Internet gambling '' while you stick your fingers in your ears and proclaim to be shocked, shocked gambling was going on with an FNBO  credit card. No, the agreement says that you " may block any Transaction that we identify as a restricted Transaction under the Unlawful Internet Gambling Enforcement Act of 2006 or other  applicable law. '' So why would you allow such transactions to go on? Why did your company not identify over 250 offshore gambling charges, with foreign transaction fees to XXXX and XXXX, when we could figure out what they were shortly after first seeing them? Most credit card companies can pick up such shenanigans quickly. Why did n't yours? 
Note that you are not denying that these are illegal online gambling charges. At any rate. you would think that after the 5th or 10th strange foreign transaction fee connected with a company with a name like " XXXX XXXX, '' that your computers ' algorithms would realize something was awry. Instead, you let over 250 such transactions go through without any issue, or with giving any alert to the primary cardholder. My mother was in her mid-XXXX by then, had XXXX XXXX, was not internet-savvy and did not grasp what her grandson was doing with the card. Instead, she paid the bills without understanding what those mysterious charges were. It was your company 's job to protect her, and you failed. 

So we are still seeking the sum of {$11000.00} to be removed from this account. If your company still refuses to take responsibility for this situation, we may be compelled to pursue other avenues to resolve this claim, including legal action. Thank you for your time and attention to this matter.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

When Seterus received a check for {$660.00} in XXXX from the County Tax Department that should have triggered an escrow analysis. County tax departments do not just issues refunds. Instead they pocketed the money and increased my Mortgage! 

I want my {$120.00} back. I want them to get their act together and bill customers according to the actual escrow bills.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XXXX XXXX, XXXX, I placed an order on XXXX shopping site for a pasta maker. Order number XXXX ( see attached receipt ). I have an approved XXXX credit card used for these purchases and they are typically paid in 6 installments and charged to the XXXX card. The company provides " SMART label '' return service for some items. This means you print a smart label out from their website or use the one sent with the shipment to return the item. This avoids customer having to pay upfront for the return it is then instead deducted from the amount of the refund due and it is their tracking system so it is supposed to provide " hassle-free returns ''. In this instance, I printed smart label from the website ( see attached ) Tracking number is XXXX, I dropped it off at the USPS office on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. The USPS office provides a " drop off-label receipt '' but that label is not traceable according to the postmaster ( ridiculous ). For informational purposes, the Label # on the USPS drop off receipt is very faint in photo attached but is XXXX it shows it was accepted at XXXX on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. It was accepted by Clerk # XXXX Bill # XXXX The USPS tracking number on the smart label is traceable and if you enter that number in the USPS or XXXX tracking site ... it shows it was received by the post office. Nothing else. XXXX tells me that it must still be at the post office. I went to the post office on XXXX XXXX to drop off another package and I checked up on it and USPS rep said it was no longer at their location so it must have been picked up by the XXXX third-party vendor ( XXXX ). In the meantime, I have submitted multiple email complaints, called and sent copies of the tracking label and proof of receipt by the post office to XXXX. I get canned email responses or a response that tells me no one has paid attention to the documents I have sent previously or my prior emails. Apparently, they are passing the buck to the third party vendor XXXX they have contracted to handle the Smart Label returns. 

On XXXX/XXXX/XXXX I called again and received a helpful representative. I provided the smart label information to the representative who put it in their own " tracking '' system ( I attached copy of those screen shots from their site that shows it was accepted by USPS ) and said she could see it was showing that it was still at the post office. She opened a case number to start tracking down the issue. The case number is XXXX. She told me to give it 3 days and if I have not heard anything to call back. 

Today XXXX/XXXX/XXXX I called and a representative tells me an email was sent out this morning after XXXX XXXX to me. I told her I have not received it. She said it can take up to 24 hours for an email to go out. (??? ) They have no problem getting an instant email out to me when I place an order or placing a charge on my card. Anyway, she reads it to me over the phone and says that they can not find any confirmation of that Smart label and I need to fill out papers and provide the proof. ( It is their smart label!! printed from their site! how can they not be tracking that .... and I have emailed it to them previously. Now, all the sudden if I do n't respond by the XXXX with the documentation and a notarized statement that I wo n't get refunded. First I do not have the document yet that they say they emailed to me plus I have to pay to get it notarized? 

The credit provider is blaming a third party vendor they contracted with and is purposely trying to create a difficult situation so that they can keep charging my XXXX store credit card for the 6 monthly payments and not refund my money. 

The customer service representatives are not helpful and you can not get anyone in authority on the phone to discuss the matter.

Around Fall of XXXX, I received a collection call from a company I never heard of nor ever did business with : XXXX. Then I started receiving demand letters about a loan they made online and sent to a bank ( XXXX ) where I 've never had any type of account ever. I never received a monthly statement, an email or any communication but allegedly " my account '' was months over due. I told them it was not me, I did not know them and never made any online or other loan. They passed me to their fraud department at XXXX. They never sent me any documentation about the alleged loan, like signature or application papers or dates as required by FDCA law but ultimately stopped calling. 

Then later in XXXX they sold ( I guess ) their junk paper to XXXX XXXX XXXX  without disclosing the identity fraud and XXXX XXXX XXXX starting to harass me. This time, as suggested, I filed a criminal complaint with local police and the Federal ITVA ( Identify Theft Victim 's Complaint and Affidavit. I also put fraud alerts with all major credit reporting agencies. This info was made known to XXXX and they stopped calling. 

Now, it appears XXXX XXXX XXXX has sold their junk paper again without disclosing that it was a fraudulent loan and XXXX XXXX started calling. After telling them the story and asking for documents, it reply is maliciously placed derogatory information into my credit report showing this is under currently collection.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative: I borrowed {$750.00}. in XXXX XXXX. Repayment amount was not disclosed. Money placed in checking account 3 days later. First month repayment, XXXX XXXX, XXXX, {$240.00}, remaining balance over {$1000.00}. Next installment {$240.00}. With remaining balance over {$1000.00}. Payments increase as does amounts owed. Decline in principal is offset by increase in fees or " interest. '' No montly payment listed for loan amount when signed up. Never ending cycle. No customer service available.

To Whom It May Concern at Consumer Protection Financial Bureau : XX/XX/XXXX # XXXX I am writing in response to Freedom Mortgages ( FM ) statement from XXXX XXXX XXXX. I will use CSR for Customer Service Representative in my response. 
I apologize to you for not getting back sooner, but I became ill and then went out of town over XXXX and I am just getting back on the computer and saw these emails from you all. 
Lets start with the address he said I have on file. Perhaps a clerical error however I receive mail from FM at : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX. He states twice that my address is : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX How could this be? But this is what I am dealing with. 
He states my phone number on record is XXXX. I spoke with XXXX # XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX # XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX, XXXX # XXXX ( late in XX/XX/XXXX ) and XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX and to each of these woman I gave my current phone number which you now have too. There were more CSRs I gave the new phone number to however I dont have them listed as it just became a sad joke to me and XXXX XXXX that they would NOT correct it. If you are willing to do a 3way call with me I would be happy to call their Customer Service Dept. again at XXXX, with you as a witness so you too can see what Im up against. FM states these calls are recorded so there is a trackable record that I have tried to correct this on numerous occasions. Several of these conversations took place at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX on speaker phone with XXXX XXXX XXXX as a witness and he can verify that I gave them my new phone number several times. XXXX XXXX may be reached at XXXX, or XXXX. I started making my calls to FM having a witness with me because they just blatantly lie. And I have the mentality that everyone is going to believe the huge corporation over me! 
Next, I never gave them the work phone number of XXXX to FM, as that is my exhusbands work phone number and he is unable to take personal phone calls. I have only used that number a handful of times in the XXXX  years we were married, for emergencies. FM took the liberty of putting that phone number on record themselves. And he is now retired so that number is not a good number anymore either. 
Now, as to the comment, Please note that no court has the right to remove a divorced party from an obligation without joining the owner of the debt as a party to a lawsuit such as the divorce lawsuit. I dont understand what he means. XXXX and I are both the owners of the debt and we were both a party to the divorce lawsuit in which the Judge, XXXX and I agreed he would own the home in MI and I would own the condo in FL. I now have the Quit Claim Deed solely in my name for my condo. So, his language sounds like XXXX should be removed from the FM loan and the loan be put in my name solely because we were both joined in a lawsuit as owners of a debt that XXXX was removed from and I shouldnt have to refinance the loan. If for no other reason than common curtesy and for Customer Service, FM should put XXXX XXXX OR XXXX XXXX on all transactions they have with me. 
As to his comment FM sent me a check for {$660.00} and I havent cashed it yet. Lets start with, the check FM sent to  me and dated XX/XX/XXXX was in the amount of {$670.00} not {$660.00}, perhaps another clerical error or just another reason not to trust their math, and it was made out solely to XXXX XXXX and my name was not on the Pay to the Order of line at all ; no and or or was listed anywhere with my name on the Pay to the Order of : line. I do not remember if the words stop payment were the exact words used, but if you listen to their recorded phone call the FM CSR/manager clearly understood the intent of the call and stated that they, in fact, would reissue the check with my name on the Pay to the Order of line on the check. Again, and if for no other reason than common curtesy and for customer service, FM should put XXXX XXXX OR XXXX XXXX on all transactions they have with me. 

Now to the financial part, I am glad he was honest and said he received {$560.00} in escrow when FM bought my loan, as I havent called XXXX XXXX at XXXX XXXX XXXX or XXXX to verify this yet. So thank you XXXX XXXX, for that as it is more than what I have on record so far.

Company: HUNTINGTON NATIONAL BANK, THE - FIRSTMERIT BANK, N.A. BRANCH

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Trouble with how payments are being handled
Consumer complaint narrative:
This evening, XXXX/XXXX/XXXX I called, yet again, the Navient call center. After being assured by a phone call in XXXX and by response to my complaint to the CFPB just a couple weeks ago that the fraudulent forebearance that Navient put my account in would be reversed and my accounts would be set back to the proper repayment plan ; it became apparent today that this did not occur. For more times than I can count Navient has yet again lied about consumer 's repayments. 

My payment is supposed to be {$100.00} set up via autopay on the XXXX of every month with the first payment at this amount being on XXXX XXXX, XXXX. However, only {$37.00} was autodrafted yesterday with 2 of my account suddenly showing that they do not enter repayment until XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. This is FRAUDULENT information again, as they were to enter repayment on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. Navient is attempting to steal money from me by continuing to gain interest they do not deserve. 

When I called tonight I was LIED to by the first customer service rep. I explained the issue that was occurring and all she would say is autopay is set up for XXXX XXXX ... she would n't even read the account. USELESS. Then she claimed there was no one there to help me when I requested a manager saying I would have to wait for a call back in 24 to 48 hours. After threatening to yet again report Navient to the CFPB, suddenly she found a supervisor. Obviously these agents are told to try and put consumers off with lies so Navient can keep collecting interest they have not earned and to keep consumers in the dark on their repayment plans. 

The supervisor refused to help me because apparently by reporting them to the CFPB I now am not able to be serviced by the contact center, only an " Advocate '' is allowed to speak to me. She can not give me a name or a phone number for these supposed " Advocates ''. 

So now Navient is retaliating against consumers that report them for their fraudulent operations and refusing to provide any customer service, repayment assistance etc. 

WHAT WILL IT TAKE FOR YOU TO SHUT THEM DOWN??!!!

Starting on Thursday XXXX XXXX, both myself and relatives have gotten calls daily from someone attempting to locate me. So far theyve called from : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Same recording every time. Online searches show that its a payday loan scam, they say that you have a payday loan outstanding, and you have to pay up or face consequences. Related to this, I got the same type of calls two years ago, and ended up paying after the caller emailed me a validation of debt, which in hindsight was probably fake. 

I havent taken out any payday loans, but theyre insistent and say maybe you just dont remember. I literally have not taken or borrowed any money, yet these phone calls from scammers just fall out of the clear blue sky for no reason, known to me.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Over the summer, forget the exact date but can look it up if needed. I have the capital one buypower card. I went into a store one day and purchased something worth a little over 4 dollars. This card is one of had for a while and would purchase things with occasionally. The card payments were set on automatic payments as I have set up on all my other accounts. However, one day I got an email stating that my payment was late. Confused by the email I called the company and the lady I spoke with assured me that my card had automatic payments. When I asked if the payment would be made and everything would be okay. She again assured me that everything is taken care of. My sole purpose of the call was to make a payment. However, the customer service agent failed to tell me that their system for automatic payments stopped working ... they stopped them altogether. And that my automatic payment would not go through before the time limit in which they would send the missed payment to the bureau. I hung up the phone assured that the payment would be made. I just assumed the system was taking it at the last minute like it usually does. A few weeks go by and I again get an email. This time from XXXX XXXX  telling me that there was a hit on my score. When I checked it turned out to be that missed payment. My automatic payment did n't go through like the lady assured me it would. And now I have my FIRST missed payment on my credit report which was not my fault. I was not notified the company took off automatic payments on their own. And when I called in the first time I was not made aware that had the payment not been taken that day it was going to go on my credit report. I remind you ... the balance was XXXX dollars. I was calling that day with the intention of clearing it out. It 's XXXX dollars .... of course I wanted to pay it off. I 've never missed a payment. Ever. As seen on my report. When I called in the second time the lady asked if I wanted to take care of the payment and I assured her that I would. And that lady is the one who made me aware that I was not on automatic payments and that they stopped my automatic payments ... without telling me. When I filed a dispute with the company they called back and took absolutely no blame for their employee misleading me as a customer and allowing my credit score be affected. I feel extremely mistreated by this company and do not feel as if a XXXX dollar missed payment should be on my credit report ... out of all the payments I 've made. Especially if I had automatic payments and was assured by the first individual that it was still active. I tried filing a dispute on XXXX XXXX but nothing came of it. I hope that you all can clearly see how I was mislead and abused as a customer. 

Thanks, XXXX

I called chase and they said there were no records of any auto loan application in their records and so there should not have been a hard inquiry. They did not want to update XXXX because they said that since there were no records on file, I would have to call XXXX  directly. On XX/XX/XXXX, I called XXXX to dispute this, and they refused to dispute it or to investigate or to call Chase. I explained I did already and that they needed me to call experian to dispute and when they dispute, they 'll remove it because there are no records. He said no, I have to call Chase again. Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
This is a general and ongoing problem with XXXX XXXX XXXX. I have 2 credit cards with them trying to rebuild my credit. 

The payment for one of the cards is the XXXX of the month. They charge a late fee on the same day of {$25.00}. They state that the bill is due by XXXX XXXX eastern time. 

I have had a " real '' credit card that offers grace period before late fees are applied which is customary, certainly not charged the same day the payment is due. 

I find this strict billing on cards that are designed for the poor, trying to get back on their feet predatory lending and an effort at forced profit from the poor repulsive. I am reporting this on behalf of every person who is surprised how challenging it is. 

Its bad enough they carry the highest interest. 

Please consider holding these lenders accountable and at the very least support legislation to reel in this repugnant behavior. Reminds me of XXXX XXXX XXXX daily deposit vs payout scheme. Something needs to be done about this. 

Thank you!

Product: Payday loan, title loan, or personal loan
Consumer complaint narrative: I have a loan out with One Main Financial, and I have been paying it faithfully, but I am sometimes late due to my paydays and how they fall. This company constantly calls me from the day the bill is due until like a day after the bill is paid and harass me. They do n't just call once a day they call several times a day and it 's always someone different. This harassment is causing my severe stress and I am breaking out with XXXX  due to it. They will not work with me to be more flexible with the due date so that it does not create this hostile environment. I have never been so frustrated with a company as I am with One Main Financial.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Trouble with how payments are being handled
Consumer complaint narrative:
For years I have reaching out about how to make payments to my Navient loan ( s ). I learned that payments were only made to select loans and I found myself delinquent in others - even though I was paying the amount assigned monthly. I was constantly trying to get clarification form customer service. Constantly harassed with notices threatening to put my account into delinquency. 
Since XXXX, I was regularly informed that if I could n't make the payment assigned to me that I should apply and renew deferment/forbearance. At times lowered adjustments were offered but still above what I was able to pay- I was made to believe that what I had to offer was not acceptable and I needed to apply for deferment/forbearance in order to not ruin my credit. Unfortunately, in XXXX I was diagnosed with XXXX XXXX and underwent a XXXX XXXX extending the deferment/forbearance status. 
If I had been able to make payments I could afford I could have avoided the accumulation of additional debt and perhaps lowered my monthly payments. 
Today, I called to say that I could start making payments towards my loan and they again said that they could n't accept this payment, instead insisting I pay more than I can afford in my current hardship. Now they are suggesting I pay double of what I can afford and again put 2 loans into deferment/forbearance. I escalated my concerns to 3 different people until a supervisor after much " calculation '' suggested I apply for a direct loan consolation and a pay as you earn graduate income based repayment. I asked if this was a new option and he said no - it has been around for a few years. I was shocked to know that they had n't counseled me sooner. He said it was almost guaranteed that I would be approved. It 's unbelievable that six years have passed - I am a XXXX XXXX XXXX for children with XXXX and low income communities- and as I dedicated myself to service, I could have been paying towards my balance and working towards forgiveness. I feel robbed of my financial well being. Now I face medical bills that surpass my student loan. I will never climb out of this financial hole. I feel deceived. It is depressing. 
I have renewed my deferment/forbearance for 2 of my loans, paying double of my affordable contribution, awaiting my consolidation application with direct loan. I 'm learning about Navient 's deceptive and irresponsible practice today. It 's disgusting.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX, I conducted a transaction using Wells Fargo that used XXXX to pay for XXXX XXXX tickets with an individual I met on XXXX. We discussed over the phone and text messages that the terms for 4 XXXX XXXX tickets at XXXX stadium would be for {$2200.00}. He requested I use XXXX since it 's bank to bank and the electronic transfer of tickets would be made immediately. The individual mentioned that he was unable to receive the transfer, so he wanted to meet in person. After several attempts to try to meet, the individual said they cancelled the transaction, to give it a couple of days to refund, and gave the tickets to someone else. I knew immediately something was fishy so I immediately filed an online fraud claim with Wells Fargo. On XX/XX/XXXX, I followed up with Wells Fargo online fraud. Since I used XXXX, Wells Fargo claims no consumer protection and would not provide me with any information of the individual 's bank or real name after saying that the service is only for friends and family, not strangers. Absurd since that information should be readily available if they 're known to me! They said this would require a subpoena via legal avenues, so I filed a police report with the text messages with the scammer. I just received the copy of the police report today on XX/XX/XXXX Shocked that Wells Fargo and XXXX would allow this!
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action
Sub-issue: Threatened or suggested your credit would be damaged
Consumer complaint narrative:
Per Texas law, this company is required to provide proof they legally own this debt. All I continue to get is portion of statements. This is not proof they legally own this debt to be able to collect. I will be filing a compliant against them with the XXXX 

Also, this company has also failed to disclose all the names they are known by or formerly known by to me. This is also a violation of Texas law. 

Texas Fair debt collection practices. 

Texas Fair Debt Collection Practices Act 392.304. FRAUDULENT, DECEPTIVE, OR MISLEADING REPRESENTATIONS.- ( 2 ) failing to maintain a list of all business or professional names known to be used or formerly used by persons collecting consumer debts or attempting to collect consumer debts for the debt collector ; Under the Texas business and commerce code I was not provided proper notice of this debt being sold to this company nor do I have a contract or any other obligation to this company. 

Texas Business and Commerce Code - BUS & COM 9.611 through 9.613.

Our mortgage payment to LoanDepot was {$1200.00} all of XX/XX/XXXX. We set up an automatic payment of {$1300.00} per month to cover this. When we received our XX/XX/XXXX statement outlining the payment due for XX/XX/XXXX we were shocked to discover that our payment due had jumped to {$1800.00}. We have a fixed rate mortgage that includes escrow and were never advised of this kind of increase being possible. Our first call was made around XX/XX/XXXX. The loan officer that closed this loan would only tell us to call customer service to discuss. Customer service was not able to give us an answer until our sixth call. During one of these calls we were advised that the website we had been going to was not the right one and that they had just changed their site. Then we were told that our taxes had gone up so our escrow was insufficient for the end of year taxes that were due. Our county assessor advised us that our taxes had actually gone down. We decided to pay {$730.00} to avoid any issues and expected to see our regularly scheduled payment of {$1300.00} come out on XX/XX/XXXX. We were again shocked to see that both {$730.00} and {$1800.00} had been drafted by LoanDepot. On XX/XX/XXXX Several e-mails requesting that someone from LoanDepot call us back ( one to each individual listed when we sign in to our account on LoanDepot.com and one to customer service ) were responded to with requests that we call customer service or e-mail a different customer service e-mail address. One even said that they do n't draft payments!!! We did not want to call customer service because that was how we ended up in this situation in the first place. We did not receive a phone call from anyone so we called. It took 15 minutes to get a live person on the phone. On this call the representative made a similar claim about our taxes going up. When asked whether this kind of increase seemed normal she only said that it could happen. When asked for details about our previous conversation with customer service the agent claimed the calls were recorded but claimed she did n't see any notes about that conversation. We asked that they review that recording to find out if their representative had advised us that the automatic payment would be {$1800.00}. We did not agree to our automatic payment increasing beyond {$1300.00}. The customer service representative claimed that the payment would match the statement and that this was in the documentation about the automatic payment. We asked to talk with someone that was involved in analyzing our taxes and adjusting our escrow and were told that they do not take phone calls but we could e-mail yet another customer service department. This e-mail was met with an automated response on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX that said our question had been received and we should expect a response within 24 hours. It has been well over 24 hours as of the writing of this complaint and we have not received any further communication from LoanDepot.
Company public response: Company believes complaint is the result of an isolated error

Affidavit of Denial XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX COUNTY OF UNITED STATES The undersigned, XXXX XXXX XXXX, being duly sworn, hereby deposes and says : 1. I am over the age of XXXX and am a resident of the XXXX XXXX XXXX. I have personal knowledge of the facts herein, and, if called as a witness, could testify completely thereto. 

2. I suffer no legal XXXX and have personal knowledge of the facts set forth below. 

3. THIS IS NOT A DEBT VALIDATION LETTER Date : XX/XX/2017 I do hereby request that your office provide me with complete documentation to verify that I owe the said debt and have any legal obligation to pay you. 

Please provide me with the following : Agreement with XXXX XXXX XXXX that authorizes you to collect on this alleged debt The original non-electronic agreement bearing my signature stating that I have agreed to assume the debt Valid copies of the debt agreement stating the amount of the debt and interest charges Proof that the Statute of Limitations has not expired Complete non-electronic scan payment history on this account along with an accounting of all additional charges being assessed Show me that you are licensed to collect in my state ; and Your license numbers and Registered Agent In conformance to my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). If your office fails to reply to this denial letter within 30 days from the date of your receipt, all instances related to this account must be immediately deleted and completely removed from my credit file. Moreover, all future attempts to collect on the said debt must be ceased. 

Your non-compliance with my request will also be construed as an absolute waiver of all claims to enforce the debt against me and your implied agreement to compensate me for court costs and attorney fees if I am forced to bring this matter before a judge. 
Thank You, cc : Pennsylvania Attorney General Office cc : Better Business Bureau cc : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau cc : Office of United States Senator XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
The credit bureaus reached a settlement and announced, that tax liens, judgements and public records would be removed from the credit report, if the public records, did not contain certain basic identifying information : A person 's full name, address, social security number and date of birth. The requirement is that 3 of the 4 identifying information, points. Must be contained in the public record, to report it on the credit file as of XXXX 2017 ( these files, must be removed ). The minimum frequency of physical courthouse visits, to obtain newly recorded and updated public records, is ( at the very least ) every 90 days. The credit bureaus, has not physically, had a representative visit the courthouse ( s ) for public records filings and have used online services, such as XXXX for acquiring the information and has reported, this information provided, by a third party. Without any verification process, as required. And using a online service is not, within the physical visits, requirements, as set forth. 

I checked my public records and there are tax lien ( s ), listed on my credit report. 
which does n't meet the requirements to report on my credit file. There is no social security number, no date of birth, my full name is not disclosed, as well as a incorrect address. XXXX has removed the tax lien ( s ) from my credit report, as required. 
But, Equifax and XXXX, still have tax liens, listed on my credit report in violation of the new established agreement.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, or personal loan
Consumer complaint narrative: I was refused a loan I qualified for. I applied for a loan at California Check Cashing Store located at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX on Saturday XXXX XXXX, 2017.I submitted all required documents and filled out a for.I was told in order to qualify I must make at least {$2000.00} a month.The clerk who assisted me, XXXX, was begrudgingly processing the loan and said I was approved for {$2500.00} ( the max loan amount is {$5000.00} which I was trying for ). She then said she had to call 4 of my references. Two of them did not respond, so I provided two more she was able to contact. Then she told me she had to contact her supervisor before approving my loan. I waited for some time. Next she asked for a copy of my old id ( I had changed my name years ago ) which I provided. Now XXXX insisted her supervisor was going to call me and there was nothing more she could do for me. I never received a call from XXXX or her supervisor. I called back and XXXX told me they decided to deny my loan but could not provide a reason and to come back to the store to retrieve my application and copies of my documents. I returned and was provided a letter stating I was denied a loan due to the checking account I used could not be verified or did not have a sufficient balance at the time the loan was requested. XXXX never stated I had to have a certain amount of funds in my account prior to applying for the loan. Also the bank requirements was that I had to provide two most recent bank statements and a voided check ( which I did ). My current pay stub shows direct deposit into this account. I recorded this conversation with XXXX who stated I was denied for this reason by her supervisor even though I provided all documents and qualified to " apply '' for {$2500.00}. I asked for copies of my documents including the voided check and was told by XXXX she already shredded the papers. I feel I was discriminated against for getting a loan. I provided all required documents and references. My credit score is fair ( I have no bankruptcies ). I make decent income. I only needed this loan due to a temporary setback but I pay all my bills on time. I have applied for loans in the past and was never treated in such a manner. I am reaching out for assistance because I really needed this loan ad feel I was denied on the basis of my race or sexual orientation. Thank you for your time.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I sent a {$70000.00} wire to Coinbase including only the exact information they required ( without any extraneous info ) to credit my account on Coinbase. 

As of XX/XX/XXXX ( today ), SIXTEEN days later, my wire transfer to Coinbase is STILL not there. Although Coinbase claimed next day availability ( on their website ) for wire transfers as of XX/XX/XXXX. 

I filed an online complaint through XX/XX/XXXX/Coinbase after about a week, as well as ~ 2 weeks later .... and then called and even had that escalated to an upper tier, and the response I received was to stop calling because it delays the process ( see attached documentation. 

How much longer could this possibly take, the one day turnaround has been more than 2 weeks? I have missed out on huge possibilities because of their promises. 

I needed the money I sent to Coinbase so I could buy Bitcoin instantly at {$12000.00} and now it has reached over {$16000.00} ( who knows where I will even be able to buy it back in at this point ) .... 

I believe Coinbase has done this deliberately something fishy is going on here.

It is a very comfortable and scary when company pull your credit without your permission because it could be someone trying to get a credit card or a loan in your name without you knowing. Consumer complaint narrative: I made a purchase to XXXX XXXX via XXXX XXXX XXXX. Retail Card with deferred interest. I paid the account in full before the 6-month term expired. TD added a late charge of {$37.00} towards the end of the term leaving a {$37.00} balance. I complained several times and they claimed to remove it. They did not, and instead added the compiled deferred interest and now claims that I owe {$370.00} and continue to add late fees.

After speaking with Navient on XX/XX/XXXX after several times, I am disappointed in their lack of helpfulness in allowing me to make student loan payments, but instead I am having to continue using forbearance due to my inability to make payments in the amount of {$350.00} that the company has set forth. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I sent an email to XXXX which stated below : " Dear Navient, I am writing in regards to my upcoming student loan repayment. After months of going over my finances ( budgeting, reductions, etc ) and reviewing my current household dues from mortgage and utilities to childcare expenses, I am still unable to afford the payment of {$350.00} that Navient has set. The amount that would be most affordable to me is {$150.00} at best. 

I am asking Navient to meet this request on me and my family 's behalf to ensure that I am able to pay my student loans on time and in the affordable amount as to avoid delinquency or default. 

I ask that please strongly take this request into consideration. 

Sincerely, { name } '' The letter above was written to explain my current financial situation and the amount that is affordable to me. Navient called me on XX/XX/XXXX and left a voicemail to call back which I hoped would be for us to work out an affordable payment plan. I returned the call and spoke with Navient on XX/XX/XXXX to see about options of lowering my payment plan that was due on XX/XX/XXXX. During our discussion, Navient told me that I should be able to make the payment they have put in place in the amount of {$350.00} due to my household income, although they are not fully aware of our financial circumstance or other obligations. 

They let me know that there was nothing that they could do to help me lower my payments and that the only option was to pay or use up more forbearance. I had 7 months of forbearance left. My goal was to not use forbearance unless my family stumbled across hard times in which it would truly be needed ; instead I wanted to make payments to Navient in an affordable amount. 

Since telling me that I am unable to lower and make those payments, I am now using 3 of those 7 months of forbearance and I am set to start back making payments on XX/XX/XXXX. I am at a lost for what to do here now but it seems that Navient is not concerned with helping borrowers make affordable payment plans as they proclaim, but instead command us to abide by what they believe is affordable according to their standards.

Called costumer service # ( XXXX ) XXXX, and explained problem ; requested funds returned and extension and was informed that the funds are gone and there is nothing I can do. Spoke to XXXX, manager, who refused to give me last name or employee ID number. 
Having read on prepaid cards before, my understanding is that funds do not expire legally for 5 years. Additionally, it should be mentioned the printing on the card makes the expiry date impossible to read at a glance. I was surprised to find that after 6 months, my funds were removed, and considering my issues with the card, was dismayed that no consideration was given to extending funds earned. My husband and I both wasted hours of our precious family vacation time with the promise of {$100.00}. I feel the circumstances merit some sort of recognition and assistance to ensure people can use the funds they funds they are promised.

Consumer complaint narrative: In XX/XX/XXXX I filed a complaint against the Bank of America about not reporting to the credit bureaus that I have a mortgage. This has greatly affected my credit score and the amounts I pay on my credit cards interest rates. My previous complaint number with the CFPB is XXXX. I believe the CFPB closed the file after the response by the B of A. After I read the response by the Bank of Americas employee " XXXX XXXX '' I was greatly concerned about the blatant dishonest statements he made in his response. To be more accurate he blatantly lied to the CFPB. To make it worse he did it in writing. The only thing I have been trying to do is get the B of A to report my mortgage payments to the credit reporting agencies.The B of A 's continual response is I have not reaffirmed my mortgage after my bankruptcy in XX/XX/XXXX. I contacted my bankruptcy attorney XXXX XXXX and asked if this was true. She explained to me that when I modified my mortgage under the Obama plan that I had reaffirmed my mortgage. Her office also explained to me that for some reason the only mortgage holders who refuse or give continual problems to customers about this issue is the B of A. She has told me to contact the B of A to remedy this issue. I have contacted to B of A and the CFPB about this issue and the issue still has not been remedied. In the response to the CFPB dated XX/XX/XXXX " XXXX XXXX '' employee of the Bank of America stated on page 2 paragraph 3 under RESPONSE, XXXX XXXX stated that as of XXXX XXXX that my mortgage was in Default Status. Why would XXXX XXXX make such a dishonest statement. Did this make him feel like a big person, or has the Bank of America gone back to their old ways of doing business by making a home owner feel like they may lose their house by defaulting on their loan when they are not actually in default. At the time of the letter written by XXXX XXXX my house payment was two weeks late not in default status. There is huge difference. Also my mortgage payment was made. I am once again asking that the B of A report my mortgage payments to the credit reporting agencies and investigate why XXXX XXXX would make such a dishonest statement to the CFPB. Federal agencies and the customers of The B of A should all be allowed honest statements and reporting by the Bank of America. Making dishonest statements and not doing what is right only reduces the amount of trust the public and federal agencies have in a institution such as the Bank of America.
